description:
Like a load of other reviewers we had set off with intentions of eating at 8am but the wait was too long so we wandered off and noticed this place with plenty of spare tables. I'm not sure why to be honest as it's one of the nicest breakfasts I've had while touring California. 

My son had a fat stack of pancakes and side of bacon, I had the California omelette and my husband the Spanish omelette. All were delicious and the portions big enough that we can skip lunch now.
author: Jo M.

description:
Similar to others on here, we wandered over when the wait was way too long at 8AM and am glad we did! Their breakfast burrito was delicious and large and the stuff was friendly.

Only complaint is the timing of the food. The first plate came out to our table about 10 minutes before the next 2, then about 5 more minutes until the final one. Didn't make much sense, especially with a party of just 4, but it was well worth the wait.

I'll certainly be coming back here next time I'm in the wharf for breakfast.
author: Kirk M.

description:
Joanie's was good enough for a quick breakfast stop on a Sunday morning. We had originally planned on going to the place next door but after looking at the wait and the menu at the other place, we decided to come in here. There was no wait and only about 1/3 of the dining area filled, which originally made me skeptical about the place but they had a big screen TV in the back with the football game on so we were sold and grabbed the table in the back corner. Our server was nice and the food came out quickly. They do not serve alcohol at this place, which was a bummer because we could have gone for a Bloody Mary.

I went with an omelette made with egg whites and vegetables and it came with home fries and toast on the side. They did not have any gluten free options for toast and they did not have rye bread either so their side options seemed a bit limiting. Their home fries were just okay, nothing spectacular about them. The omelette was tasty and healthy so I enjoyed that part. The place wasn't cheap, because I added egg whites that bumped up the cost of my omelette $4, which is steep. $22 for eggs is a lot however we were in the Fisherman's Wharf area so it can be expected we are going to be paying a pretty penny for anything. I'd recommend this place to people who want a no frills diner type of restaurant without a long wait.
author: Samantha S.

description: Hidden gem close to our hotel. Fantastic service, great food cooked exactly as ordered, pleasant atmosphere and very clean.  Our waitress was great!  Would definitely return!
author: Cindy T.

description:
HANDS DOWN, BEST BREAKFAST RESTAURANT IN SF! Went here twice on my vacation! That's how good it was! Very instagrammable place with some very delicious foods! Ordered "The Crown" and "Unicorn Pancakes". Phenomenal!!! No other way to put it! Servers are very nice and greet you with a smile the moment you come in. Service is very fast and accommodating, no other way to put it. This is a must go to! Wish they had something like this in Dallas! // On my youtube channel, I posted a vlog eating here along with other videos of my San Francisco vacation! Check it out!   
https://youtu.be/A1Zn98ZzHxA
author: Maddy.tv ..

description:
Joanie's was a great experience , i ordered the veggie but better sandwich. I will be back :-)

only down side, the service was a little slow. overall everyone was very nice :)
author: Tayton M.

description: Tasty food, good service, Joanie her self is very happy and friendly.  Stop in and you'll be glad you did the French toast was AWESOME!
author: Bruce P.

description: Wow! Awesome breakfast, great service, and a very nice environment too. The washroom was impressively clean & the kitchen (can be seen from outside) was also spotless. I wish we were in SF longer, so we could try it again!
author: K R.

description:
Accidentally went here instead of 8am.  Nothing against 8am, this place is awesome.
California omelette: excellent
Challah French toast: amazing
Two eggs over easy: perfect
I highly recommend this place
My SO asked me to mention the amazing service
Five stars all the way
author: Steve A.

description: Really good food and great service.  On the same short block as 2 other good restaurants that you'd be able to hit if this place is too busy.  Only downside was the bill.  It became our most expensive meal of our SFO visit which took us by surprise.  Be sure to split meals if not too hungry, especially if getting the pancakes.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I was looking for a good breakfast joint near my hotel in Fisherman's Wharf. My wife and I had settled on another breakfast place called "8 a.m.", not sure why--probably because it came up first on Google and it was relatively close by. When we got to the restaurant there was easily a 30 minute wait. The host snapped at us and told us to write our name on the list they had outside at the door. 

However, just two doors down, on the same block, was Joanie's. My wife and I noticed there was no wait and the diners eating outside in sunny weather looked happy. They had big plates with great looking portions. So we went over and were greeted by a very pleasant young man who seated us immediately. The establishment itself is somewhat humble looking, but very tidy and neat. 

The menu had a wonderful assortment of breakfast foods: waffles, challa French Toast, omelettes, different hot coffees and teas, burgers and sandwiches. I settled on The Crown Waffle, a side of sausage and some corned beef hash (I was hungry--we did a bike tour of the Golden Gate bridge and Sausalito the day before), and my wife had The Californian omelette with chorizo sausage. The plates arrived shortly and were nicely plated large portions. 

The waffle had huge ripe berries, fresh whipped butter and cream. The sausages were perfectly cooked and juicy. The waffle was easily an inch and a half thick and cooked just right. The corned beef hash was nicely browned to give it a nice carmelized crust and very tasty. My wife's omelette was delicious, with a healthy portion of chorizo, avocados, cheese and vegetables layered in between the expertly cooked eggs. The two young men who assisted us were very attentive and never made us look around for help. 

We were very pleasantly surprised at our experience and my wife even took a picture of the sign outside so she could remember what breakfast joint we will be visiting every time we come to San Francisco. Joanie's was a very nice surprise. 

The moral of the story? Don't always go for what Google is trying to sell you. There are a lot of good, and even great,  restaurants out in the world that are waiting to be discovered beyond the internet search results.
author: LF M.

description: Excellent breakfast one block from Fisherman's wharf. Sit inside or on the patio.  Great service.
author: Jennifer P.

description: I've been here before and i remember falling in love with my breakfast burrito! I got the veggie burrito and added chorizo (kinda defeats the purpose of going veggie but the veggie burrito came with so many more wonderful things than the regular one does). This time i tried the Challah french toast and the turmeric ginger tea. The service was AMAZING!!! The waitress/owner Joanie really knew her stuff! She was so down to earth i never would have known she was the owner until i asked her name. Love her!!! She was friendly and helpful and told me all about the wonderful tea selection and other tasty items to try on my next visit. (And there WILL BE a next visit) They have fresh squeezed orange juice which is also a plus!
author: Jayd S.

description: Great breakfast spot, glad we stopped in! I had the banana waffles and my wife had the blueberry pancakes! Amazing! Everyone else food that was coming out looked great as well!
author: Tracy U.

description:
DON'T GO HERE IF YOU JUST WANT COFFEE. 

Um, $3.60 for coffee that's just be sitting on the burner for god knows how long? No thank you. Even for San Francisco that's ridiculously over-priced. I could go to Peet's and get an awesome cup of freshly brewed coffee for $2.50. I know, I know, it's in a touristy area, etc., etc., but seriously, as a San Franciscan, paying $3.60 for crap coffee goes against everything I believe in!!
author: Rie U.

description:
We came here cuz someone at our hotel recommended. It is the worst restaurant we had been in the SF area. The food is way overpriced and their attitude to the customer is extremely bad. The old Chinese lady claimed that they charge everyone 18% gravity (no matter how many people in the party) for breakfast, but it turned out that they are the only restaurant that does it in the area ( and probably they thought we didn't know the norm here in the states and we are Chinese visiting here the first time) . Go to the 8 AM next door!!! Better food, 18% only for party of 4 or more. 

After asking about the gravity, the old lady started saying that it was her policy, her rule (she said that she always pays 20% when she go out to eat lol, what a joke). 

Btw, cash only? Lol broken credit card machine? Same old same old. Tax season coming, I guess?

Now I have to warn all the Chinese here. 

千万不要去这家店他们有一个泼妇一样的广东老女人收钱。以为我们是第一次来的中国人想要坑小费，真是无耻到极点。坑也就算了，满嘴胡说八道，谎话连篇。作为中国人真希望这种败类不要说自己是chinese，这样你见到华人下次还可以收50%。为了几块钱也不跟你争了，因为就是你这样的服务态度和素质，才有这样的生活。
author: Shijia W.

description: This place still holds it's 5 star review from me it's my second time visiting San Fran. I've been here twice. The first time was 5 years ago before I used Yelp. Proud to say this place is still the same breakfast place that I went to 5 years ago. The inside changed to a more modern look which really suits the place. Love the place, love the food. Service was very good, very nice employees. I got the going banana waffles and would recommend it to anyone that came here.
author: Josh H.

description: We took a chance on this little diner and am so glad that we did. The food was outstanding - huge portions- excellent presentation but more than anything the customer service was like no other. My coffee cup was always filled and everyone from the cook to handful of servers greeted us and checked in on throughout our meal. I can't wait to come back and try lunch!!
author: Jenny V.

description:
Great breakfast diner not far from Fisherman's Wharf.  Opens at 7am, perfect for early risers.

We ordered the chorizo breakfast burrito and the corned beef hash & eggs.  Both were delicious!

Fast, friendly service.. check this place out!
author: Bill S.

description: Saw the line at a nearby restaurant and kept walking. So glad I did! Joanie's was delicious and had fast, great service! I had the croissant sandwich with egg, cheese and sausage with hash browns. It was huge - enough to have shared. I was amazed at dishes coming out to other patrons; huge piles high waffles, omelette stuffed so full they were nearly as big as the plate. Try it, you won't be disappointed. I felt sad for those still choosing to wait in line down the street while I had a happy full belly!
author: Lori R.

description: You are better off literally going anywhere else. Service is excruciatingly slow. Table next to us has a very similar experience and conversation about the service. Their food order wasn't correct. 40 minutes in and we haven't seen our food yet.
author: Kosta P.

description: Horrible service. We waited over an hour for our food and watched people who had come in after us all get their food. Not once did the waiters apologize. The manager was incredibly rude and unprofessional. I completely understand when a restaurant gets busy but own up to your mistakes. We didn't even get have of our food because they forgot about it. We will never be coming back.
author: Kaley G.

description: Great breakfast stop. Great breakfast food, fresh fruit, egg sandwich, French toast, and Belgian waffles. Didn't try the other menu items.
author: Chuck C.

description: I usually go on Yelp to complain.  NO COMPLAINTS HERE.  Food excellent,  Service excellent.  Huge portions.  Bathroom immaculate. Hard working staff.  A plus!
author: Sam W.

description:
This is probably the worst place to get breakfast, especially after you see 4 stars, expect 4 star quality food, and end up getting .5 star food. 

I order the breakfast burrito with bacon and my husband ordered the typical American breakfast, eggs, hash browns, toast and a hamburger patty. My burrito was meh...like how can you mess up a breakfast burrito?! My eggs were dry and super over cooked, and I noticed that they used whole American cheese slices. YUCK! The best part was the tortilla! My husband's food was such bad quality, we had to send it back! His burger patty was obviously a frozen party and tasted horrible. His sunny side up eggs were dry and pathetic. 

The best part was the young man that served us! Very friendly, super helpful! Needless to say, we WILL NOT be coming back.
author: Nickie F.

description: Great breakfast. Pancakes, waffles & breakfast burrito were fantastic. ...and fresh squeezed orange juice.
author: Dave M.

description: Delicious breakfast and delightful staff to serve us! We even got some great tips on sightseeing around San Francisco!
author: Lillian C.

description: Food came in little late but the pancake is worth waiting. Nice and fluffy pancake & crispy sausage links. Giving it 4 star as the hash browns were little oily. Wait staff were polite and helpful
author: Sarita G.

description: What an awesome little find. In my wife took the trolley from downtown to the fisherman's wharf. We are looking for a quick breakfast spot to get our day started but every breakfast spot was filled with people and we didn't want to wait in line. I am very impatient when I am hangry in the morning :) I like a pretty simple breakfast I'm looking for bacon, eggs hashbrowns, and quick service. This place completed my checklist. We sat down right away and were able to watch Little College football on the tube and started chugging coffee to get her day started we knew we were going to be putting some miles on our shoes that day. Our server was super friendly and was able to answer the questions we had about what we should be doing while we were in town. I ordered the corn beef hash which is one of my favorite breakfast selections and was excited to see it on the menu. Our server checked back on us frequently even though they were getting a little rushed and made sure we were happy the whole time. This place is simple but very satisfying. Now that I know about this secret hole in the wall in San Francisco I will be coming back frequently every time I am in town.
author: Eric S.

description: Fresh juice is delicious, endless coffee, great views, great service.... what more do you really need?
author: Zac A.

description: The orange juice is delicious the coffee taste wonderful all the food was great but the service wasn't the best, all the food didn't come out at once. My friend got his food I waited 3 minutes for mine then my brother got his food, but when he got his food my friend was done eating. I enjoyed the food very much but if they work on better service I promise it'll be a great place. Also very expensive
author: Taha I.

description: Before catching our tour of San Francisco, we stoped in to Joanie's based on the great Yelp reviews. My 17 week pregnant wife wanted real breakfast food before our long day of site seeing. I ordered the oatmeal which came with brown sugar, raisins, and bananas. She ordered the French toast,  eggs and sausage. Everything was perfect and they made sure we had refills on water and coffee. That's all we needed and we were ready for the day!
author: Sam T.

description: We had breakfast here on a busy Sunday morning.  It was decent diner fare.  I got eggs over easy (which was a bit too easy) bacon extra crispy (which came out not very crispy) and country potatoes.  My wife had corned beef hash.  We both found it to be run of the mill average diner fare.
author: Zen D.

description:
Found this place while walking to Ghirardelli Square. It's a very small place, right next to the "Go-Car Tours" business. There are 2 tables outside (4 seats each), a couple more inside, and a bar counter. 

The hostess was not only our waitress, but also our cook. It was a Tuesday morning, and the only other breakfast place nearby was a Denny's, so we figured that we would try a place that we don't have in our hometown. 

My husband and I shared a bacon breakfast burrito with a side of toast. It took a little longer than we expected, since there was only one other party seated inside. But, it made sense when our waitress told us she was the one who was cooking that day. 

The burrito wasn't anything to brag about. It was like a bacon omelette, wrapped in a tortilla. The salsa tasted like it was store bought. 

I would have given this place a higher rating, however, the area wasn't too great. The employees next door were loud and cursed a lot. I don't mind a curse word here or there, but it was as if every other word was one. Also, there's a small park across the street, filled with the homeless drinking their morning "beverages".
author: Cat T.

description: They didnt tell us it would be 18% tip for four people or more. The service was not great. Staff seemed a little rude. The food was okay but small portions and WAY TOO EXPENSIVE for just OK food. Would have been better off going to dennys... definitely wont be returning here.
author: Monica P.

description: This was the first restaurant I visited when I started using Yelp. 7 years and god knows how many visits later it's still my favorite breakfast anywhere. It's busy but I've never had to wait in line for a table. The staff is friendly and fast. The food is terrific. Bacon is crisp without being burnt. Pancakes are perfect texture and size. They have all kinds of scrambles and used to have breakfast tacos...not sure if they are on the new menu or not. It's not a bargain but not much in SF ever is. It's quality and worth a visit.
author: Heath H.

description: JOANIE'S IS THE GREATEST DINER ON EARTH. SHOUTOUT THE GAWD. Amazing food, amazing service, amazing woman. Checkout Joanie's for the greatest breakfast and lunch west of the Mississippi. Thank you.
author: Ryan N.

description: I'm not a huge breakfast eater, especially when traveling, but after eating breakfast at Joanie's (twice!), I left full and happy. Service was great, everyone was super friendly. Dare I say it, but I think Joanie's turned me into a breakfast person?! Should I find myself in San Francisco again, I will DEFINITELY visit Joanie's Happy Days Diner.
author: Jenna P.

description: Amazing food with amazing service!! My coffee cup was always full!! Staff was always walking around making sure you where all taken care of.
author: Billy M.

description: Had a great breakfast at Joanie's Happy Day Cafe.  Great service.  Highly recommend it, especially when you need fast service.
author: Joseph M.

description: This place was incredible!  Good portions, great location, and great service!  Must try!  Close to warf making it convenient for breakfast before tours.
author: C H.

description: If you want a good breakfast.   This is the spot.  We tried Buena Vista but it was busy. This one hit the spot with the Hobo breakfast of scrambled eggs with everything in them. My wife had a veggie omelette in the image. Yum.
author: Josh T.

description: Yummy!!  Service was amazing and the food was delish!!  My plan was to go to 8 am , which is literally next door but the wait was insane; I yelped and realized that this place was on the same street... lucky me and what a great way to end my stay in San Francisco!!  Thanks you guys!  Keep up the positive energy and smiles!!  Blueberry pancakes were fantastic!!!!!
author: Crizelda M.

description: I had breakfast tacos. They were great. I sat by my self outside and had a great view of the world going by. The device was great. The severs were very kind and attentive. Beautiful people.
author: Wesley M.

description:
Very solid American breakfast joint. NEVER disappoints!

I love this place for the quick and friendly services, reasonably priced dishes in Fisherman's Wharf, and the consistent presentation of food.

I usually order the corned beef hash Benedict with country style potatoes. Everything about the Benedict is PERFECT. The potatoes are very fresh and I love the flavor from the green onions.

I also like to order the pancakes, which are perfectly fluffy and goes well with the BOTTOMLESS bold coffee. :)
author: Leilani Y.

description: Joanie's Happy Days Diner is a really cute restaurant with great service (it appears to be family owned). After eating road trip and hotel food for a day and a half, I was very happy eating real food. I unfortunately don't remember the name of what I ordered, but it was a sandwich on sourdough with fresh veggies in it. Maybe I was just really deprived of real food, but the vegetables were incredibly fresh. As a vegan who typically shies away from (usually bland) veggie sandwiches, I would highly recommend the one here.
author: Fiona H.

description: Good for a quick breakfast, very casual, a small diner with limited outside seating. It seems like a family business with all the family working together. The service we good and efficient. I ordered eggs Benedict and it was cooked very nicely, however I feel like many places usually offer a toast or a pancake with the main entree but this place just had the dish!
author: Steven W.

description:
So this small little diner is fantastic. Only about 15 tables in the whole place with 3 people running around taking care of everyone. Every server helps the other, so you are hardly lacking for care. The food portions are very big and so tasty. 
I got the fat crab eggs benedict. Dungeness crab and spinach should not work on eggs benedict but it did and was amazing. We are going back tomorrow before we leave. Just awesome all around.
author: John S.

description:
Joanie is hilarious. The place is quaint. 

And the food is solid. 

You can't go wrong here.
author: Adam S.

description: Good old fashioned diner and is open early.  In a great little part of the area by the cannery. I had the corned beef hash.  Seemed like they made it with the canned corned beef and then mixed with hashbrowns and fried into a patty. Not how I would have made it and next time I would pick something else, but it tasted ok. Everyone was friendly and helpful and service was fast
author: David G.

description:
Do you want French toast and bacon or fried eggs with country fried potatoes you have found your spot. If you want a kale omelette move on.

This is a simple diner, with friendly staff and tasty food. We ate here both mornings we had in San Francisco.  Apple juice, coffee, french toast, light and fluffy pancakes, oatmeal, the bacon was a nice level of crispy (just the way I like it), I preferred the country fried potatoes to the hash browns.  Having the option to get some good old San Francisco sour dough for your toast was a nice touch.

If it's nice you can even sit outside and enjoy the sunshine.

There is nothing fancy about this diner, it is a great place to grab a solid breakfast, chances are whatever you are craving is on the menu, and after a breakfast like that you have the energy to go down the street, rent a bike and ride across the Golden Gate Bridge.  

Prices were reasonable for the portions.  They do have a kids breakfast menu as well.
author: Susan I.

description:
Staff very friendly place looks clean. Food tastes like they re-use the oil after making Asian dishes or the oil is old. Burger AND fries tasted pretty bad. It's the oil...  
: (

But the soda as well as the salt were both perfect!
author: Vic K.

description:
Big family breakfast (11 people) and we got to eat on the patio.  The menu is extensive, with something for everyone to enjoy.  My sis had the waffle with fresh strawberries and it looked beautiful as well as tasted delicious.  My hobo scramble (eggs, ham, onion, cheeses) was delicious!  The French toast with mixed berries was SO yummy!  My husband loved his chicken fried steak.  The servers were very good about keeping our coffee cups filled and filling any requests.  

Highly recommend this laid back spot for big, delicious breakfasts!
author: Johnnie H.

description: Came in for lunch with my family, and ordered the cheeseburger with a side of fries. The quality of the burger was well below average, and tasted very similar to a high school cafeteria's food. Will not be returning.
author: Michael K.

description: Found this spot after eight am was extremely packed. Food was great! Only downfall was that credit card machine was down so they only took cash.
author: Florentino A.

description: With so many breakfast options around I'm glad we came here. The food was great and the portions were not small. Don't pass this place up!
author: Vanessa A.

description: Nice place for breakfast, good quality, huge meals, good service. The place is not fancy but I enjoyed anyways. Not my favorite in SF area but a really good one, near fisherman's wharf, used a Groupon and it worked perfect.
author: Ana Belen G.

description: Stopped in here for a late brunch and was not disappointed.  I had the vegetable omelette dish, which included the breakfast potatoes.  The omelette was slightly more oily than I prefer, but was otherwise fluffy with fresh veggies and a rich jack cheese.  The potatoes had a crisp spiciness, the sourdough toast was a nice addition.
author: Tom M.

description: The service was great, the food not so much. The veggies tasted spoiled and all drinks served in a can. It was an experience, but probably won't be back.
author: Jessica L.

description: 10/10 Denver omelette. Excellent service too. Really enjoyed it. They even gave us cutlery to take with us for the food we couldn't finish there. Will be back.
author: Haydn O.

description: This restaurant is conveniently located near the Holiday Inn and Marriott.  I highly recommend  the fruit salad made with an array of fresh fruit.  I also enjoyed the hot chocolate.  My husband lived his breakfast burrito and our kids liked their waffles.  I do not recommend the oatmeal, however.
author: Amy C.

description: Delicious breakfast, sweet and friendly service. Our 4 year old son had his first "crush" on Kelly! Thanks for being so sweet to him!
author: Mark F.

description: So I had bookmarked Eight am. After our run nearby I was excited to go here. Unfortunately the wait was 30 mins and we were starving. My sister saw Joanie's right next door. She said it didn't have bad reviews. It didn't look inviting at all lol. I was so bummed. I thought it would be like Denny's if not worse. Looks can be deceiving. And I was definitely proven wrong. I'm so excited as I'm writing this. Honestly that was probably the best eggs Benedict I've had. The eggs were cooked perfectly. Whites were not runny. The hollandaise sauce had great flavor. I asked for a side of bacon. I got like 6 slices of crispy yummy bacon. (My stomachs growling:). Not greasy at all. The only complaint is that I asked for spinach in my eggs Benedict. I think they forgot. The service was fast. And the food had great taste and quality. I'm so glad we came here.
author: Deepika S.

description: Bacon egg and cheese bagel was delicious. They weren't shy with the delicious thick cut bacon. Wife had the pancakes which were also legit. Big potions reasonable prices. Totally recommend. Enjoy.
author: Al W.

description: I went on a Sunday morning to this restaurant and got service right away! The food was very good and hot, they brought out the plates separately so that the food would not sit there. A little cramped but what place in San Fransisco isn't!
author: Kirsten K.

description: Breakfast was delicious.. had the French toast, eggs and bacon.  Big plate of hash browns which is perfect for sharing!! Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice little breakfast spot!!
author: Aaron K.

description: Great breakfast spot! Our family had a ham and cheese croissant, 2 egg breakfast, and ham breakfast burrito.  We would recommend all three! Service was great, food came out quick, no wait, and great prices.
author: Lindsey S.

description: This had great reviews so we decided to check it out!  I got the ham,  egg and cheese sandwich on sourdough,  my husband got the Spanish omelette  with churizo. Service was fast and friendly and food was great.  The country potatoes were my favorite,  my sandwich was a tad more greasy than I like,  but still really good.  My husband gives his omelette a 5 rating! It was nice to sit outside and enjoy the nice weather with a cup of coffee. Our bill was only $28! Cheapest meal we've had in San Francisco! I would totally go back!
author: Kristy R.

description: We had breakfast here and it was awesome!! There was a wait next door, so we popped in here and got a table right away. So glad we did. My fiance and I both had the breakfast tacos, they were phenomenal! Generous portions of avocado, fresh ingredients, they were great. Both of our kids meals were wonderful too! Super happy we happened upon this little spot, it was great!!!
author: Andrea M.

description:
Food is ok. We were a group of 4, the bill came with tip added. 
Also the CC used to pay the bill got charged fraudulently during the same night!!
author: Jeannie Y.

description:
For the love of God I cannot understand why people wait for hours to get into Hollywood cafe when there is such a great breakfast spot just 30 feet away. 
The portions are huge, the food was fresh, and the prices are very decent considering the location. 

I swallowed my California omelette in a matter of seconds. Despite the size, I still wanted more. Hash browns were probably the best I have ever had. Crispy, light and fresh fresh. My fiancé ordered French toast supreme. O-M-G - soft and crispy and eggy (in a good way) with a generous amount of butter and powered sugar. 

Oh my, the memory of my breakfast at Joanie's Happy Days Diner makes my mouth water every time I think about it.
author: Lana S.

description:
Very good omelets and lots in the plate quick service
Small place but perfect for breakfast
author: Ariel P.

description: Good food with good service. Not as crowded as some of the other cafes in the area.  Our party of 3 Had pancakes, banana waffle, eggs and bacon, and breakfast burrito - all very good.
author: Brian J.

description: Visiting SF to see a Giants game. Came here for breakfast. Food was good. Not your traditional breakfast place. Menu items are a little different which was refreshing. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because seating is a little cramped at tables and my ice tea tasted like it was poured from a bottle. But, I would go here again!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Fantastic!

Huge portions!
Delicious food!
Reasonable prices!
Great service!

Totally worth it!
One of the best breakfasts we had in SF!
author: Ted Q.

description: Where is the negative stars box? This place was a disaster. It looked good from the outside because it was full, food on other people's tables seemed nice, worth a try. The waiter forgot our drinks, then 20 minutes later checked on us and had us wait another 10 before bringing them. When we finally got our food, my eggs were raw, I had specifically asked for poached medium, the potatoes were cold-not warm-cold, there was a hair on my plate, and 1 mushroom under a poached eggs of my Benedict. Where was that from and why was it hiding under 1 of my eggs? The waiter told my husband that the toaster was broken, and that he could bring him some cold bread. What? And again why? We overheard that the credit card machine was not working, and hadn't noticed the whole restaurant sitting in the dark because we sat by the window, until the rest of the patrons cheered when the lights, ac, and electricity came on. (By the way, SF is experiencing usually hot weather, ugh) (explains why the toaster and cc machine weren't working). I've never wanted to run so fast in my life, but since we are traveling, I just wanted to eat and be on my way, but the whole situation was FUCKING NAUSEATING. This is my first bad yelp review. It totally deserved it. I will say that after I pointed out that there was no way I could eat what was on the dirty plate in front of me, they took off my disaster of a dish from the bill. Sketchy as all get up. I should have hit the road and grabbed In and Out. Lesson learned.
author: Karen B.

description: Loved my breakfast here! Kind of a hidden gem! Food was excellent, great service, good prices and huge portions... My favorite breakfast while in San Francisco!
author: Anastasia P.

description: Tried this place for breakfast when staying in the wharf area. Service was prompt and the food was good save for the cheese fries ordered by my son. Don't bother with those as they were basically an order of fries drowned in jarred cheese sauce and tossed with a few bacon bits. Regular breakfasts were cooked to order and well made. I subtract stars because $12 for an oder of eggs, bacon and toast is pretty high in my opinion and then they automatically add 18% gratuity on parties of three or more. This always gets me angry because I am someone who rewards good service with a 20 to 25% tip. The credit card machine appears to have been out of order for sometime so it is cash only at present.
author: Loretta S.

description: Delicious food! Great service. Cute outdoor seating with a view of a park. Will definitely be back!
author: Bree K.

description: Nice, basic diner-type establishment with great food and not too pricey for San Fran.  I took my family here for breakfast while we were on vacation on March 17, 2017.  I had the belgian waffle with fruit, my daughter had pancakes, and my wife ordered some fruit and grits ala carte.  Service was great, and food was plentiful and good.  Not only did we get a lot to eat, but the presentation of the fruit on my wife's and my plates was a beautiful site to behold.  Get away from the hotels in the area and eat where the locals eat.
author: Collin F.

description: First time I've had corn beef hash Benedict and it was delicious . Also the country style potatoes was super flavorful . The pancakes was also to die for. Great service. They all had a role and worked together very well.
author: Judel N.

description: Small, but quaint. It fit the bill, not memorable tho.
author: Rick G.

description:
We never got to eat here. The food looked meh. I went in to get a table and I was told there was a wait. There were a couple of people that were waiting outside, but there were a ton of empty tables that had not been cleaned off yet.
The woman brashly told me to write my name down, so I did. Once back outside, more tables cleared and yet no one was cleaning up the tables. One group which left told the group in front of us that they weren't served or even offered drinks in the 2 times they had been there during their stay.

What breakfast joint doesn't offer coffee the moment you sit down? No place that I want to eat. We went down a couple doors to Eight AM and had an amazing meal.
author: Matthew J.

description: Food is ok and not overly priced.  Service is great.  Only real problem was the slice of american cheese on top of my omelette
author: Douglas A.

description: Fast service. Excellent quality food. Get here early , place is small and fills up quick.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Pros.
Food portions are huge and flavorful 
Excellent  service
Near fisherman's warf


Cons.
Added and calculated gratitude.
Some prices can be a little expensive
Closes early
author: Bei T.

description:
My new favorite (hangover) breakfast place!
My friend and I were struggling from a night out, and were in the mood for a true American breakfast. We stumbled over to Joanie's and were welcomed by all the waiters and waitresses by warm hellos and were  immediately seated at the counter. The service was great and fast (our dark eyes probably were the give away for the coffee poured immediately when we sat down), and the food selection was perrrrfect. I had the breakfast sandwich (croissant sandwich with egg, cheese, sausage) and my friend had the breakfast burrito. We slowly devoured our meals, and can honestly say it was the best diner breakfast we've had in a very very long time. Definitely will be back soon, if anything to try the bomb pancakes or waffles that I saw on everyone else's table!
author: Paige S.

description: These guys were exceptional.  Fifteen of us showed up for breakfast and they worked hard to quickly seat and serve us.   The food was really good!   I enjoyed an omelette that was perfect.  Thanks Michael for a great breakfast!
author: Robert B.

description:
This was my best and favorite breakfast in San Francisco in years.  Scrambled eggs were soft cooked as ordered, crispy bacon and crispy hash browns.  And, the service was great.

I also want to add, that instead of greasy condiment containers, they were all sparkling clean.

We'll be back many times.
author: Sandi L.

description:
Extremely overpriced for a greasy spoon diner, food was very basic, not worth the asking price.

Do yourself a favor and find a diner farther away from the Fisherman's Wharf to combat the "tourist upcharge".
author: Guilie H.

description: Great place!  Food was good, fast, and affordable.  Service was friendly, attentive....would go there again.
author: Francis V.

description: If you are in a hurry, this is not the place to go!  Service is pretty slow but the food and serving size makes it worth the wait!  The breakfast tacos are amazing!  Very well priced, especially considering the Amount of food!
author: Carrie W.

description: Need a quick breakfast to fill your tummy before you start playing tourist?  Then this is your spot.  Huge portions, pretty fast service, and Breakfast is served until they close in the early afternoon.
author: Lxs S.

description: Skip the hipster haunts and come to this family owned old school diner. We came here for breakfast and everything was wonderful! The coffee delicious and I'm a major coffee snob.  They make real buttermilk pancakes from scratch too. Check this spot out!
author: Hungry G.

description: I did see the alert about the food safety On Yelp, After I had orders my food. I guess it doesn't mean much cause the restaurant was packed. Not sure why the alert but I didn't see much of a hazard. I figured I've eaten in worse looking places and they had amazing food. If I eat at lunch trucks what's worse. It's your typical  breakfast dinner. Everything taste good and it comes in big portions. We had breakfast pancakes eggs and waffles. The price is a bit expensive but I'll next time if you share its not that's mad.
author: Charles G.

description: A little hidden gem in the bustling area of Fisherman's Wharf.  Great food and service.  Small seating area but worth the wait.  Seating outside as well. We knew we were in for a treat at the first taste of a cup of coffee.  Spanish omelette with chorizo delicious and very filling.  The pancakes were light and fluffy.  Nice sized portions.  Costly but the cost is worth it
author: Chris S.

description:
Where's Chachie? I looked and looked, but saw no sign of him or any Happy Days theme. There's nothing in the decor; there's not even a jukebox.

Huh...What's that? Oh, it's just a gimmicky name to draw crowds in this extra touristy area?  Sorry...my bad.

As for the restaurant, Joanies was a very basic, spartan diner run by a friendly, Asian family.  Table and chairs were thin, cheap and fragile. The space was cramped.  But they did offer some outside seating on a fairly quiet street.  I arrived around 7:30 a.m., so procuring a spot at the counter was easy.  I didn't appreciate the fact that they were blasting "Good Morning America" at high volume on the TV, so I asked that they turn it down to a murmur. They complied.

As for the food, it was OK. Nothing special. My two eggs were under-cooked (made over-easy, instead of the over-medium that I had requested). Toast was plentiful, as were the home fries; but the latter were unevenly cooked (I didn't finish them).  The coffee, however, was pretty good.

Total for my breakfast plus coffee was about $12. Average for a spendy tourist zone I suppose.

When I walked by later the same morning, Joanies was absolutely packed to the limit, with one or two people waiting.  Based on my mediocre breakfast here, these crowds (and the high Yelp score) had me a bit mystified.
author: Dan B.

description:
What I ate: Biscuits and gravy!
Visit date: October 6, 2012
First time? Yes

I was bit skeptical of this place being that it's in tourist country and all, but it wasn't so bad. When biscuits and gravy are on the menu, I'm there! The biscuits were nice and moist, and the gravy was filled with salty sausage bits! Mmm. I'm not sure why, but the biscuits and gravy come with toast. I wouldn't boast too much about the food, but the service was excellent! From the greeter out front to the servers, every worker was accommodating, friendly, and welcoming. At the end of our meal, we almost felt like guests in their home.
author: Erin G.

description: After waiting about 20 minutes for a table, understandably Saturday morning wait, we were the first open table amongst four on the patio. We ordered first and the we were the last one served. Ended up frustrated by the service being so poorly executed. They were getting the run off from the next door restaurants .  The food was good , it's breakfast, so nothing exceptional. It is not quick and Starbucks may be just as good!
author: Susannah H.

description:
Since when are dogs allowed inside restaurants??? I wouldn't have eaten here if I would have saw that before I ordered. There's a Pomeranian that belongs to the owners just chilling in the dining room. So they pet him then make my food. 

Then, I ordered a mimosa, they don't have any champagne. So she tells me she'll take it off my bill. Oh, really?? That's so generous considering people don't usually pay for things you don't have. They have the front door propped open, it's raining hard so it's cold and flies are coming inside. At this point I'm really worried about the quality of food.

I got the fat crab and eggs instead of the crab bennies since it wasn't fried. Thankfully the food was fresh but the crab portion was small and I had to pull crab shell out of my mouth 3 times. There was double the amount of cooked spinach as there was crab and the English muffin was super soggy. The potatoes were ok and had lots of chives.

I picked this place because I typed in "best breakfast near me" on yelp and this came up as number 2!!! What?? I will try Hollywood cafe tomorrow. I only gave 2 stars because I didn't get sick off the food. And all this (see photo) for a mere $25. You have got to be kidding me.
author: Tiara Q.

description:
Small quaint little diner, slightly off the touristy strip. Slightly long wait for food, friendly staff, decent food presentation and good breakfast.  Cleanliness of entire establishment could be checked but overall mediocre experience. 
*Ketchup bottles refilled and reused, grinds my gears.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Was on the way to segway tours on 333 jefferson st nearby and this was quick and extremely accommodating! We ordered our breakfast and did not have to wait long - good thing we beat the rush as a line formed behind us.

Coffee was enjoyable and so were the French Toast and pancakes. Syrup is a tad runny and sausages were decent. If you're looking for something reasonably priced and a large selection of food - with a decent wait and fast service come here for your meal! They'll be ready to serve you.
author: James L.

description: Walking around SF and we wanted breakfast. This place was a few blocks away, and it had a 4 star average so why not. First off, it was busy, which is a good thing because it means it's not bad. The food is normal breakfast stuff, but HOLY COW were the portions HUGE! It's a good thing our hotel was more than 10 blocks away.
author: T P.

description: Found this place on Yelp, thank you Yelp! Located right across from our hotel. It was perfect for us. We came in at 7am and got seated right away, the food had generous portions and the family enjoyed their breakfast. I entree could feed 2 people. I got the Hobo scramble with ham, onions, bell pepper and cheese. Very good. Always get extra crispy hash browns, it tastes better. The hash brown portions are ridiculous. The staff is friendly and we for refills frequently. For our group of 6, they added the tip to the total, which was fine, but just be aware. Tip was $15 for breakfast. Filling meal to help start our day in San Francisco.
author: Jean S.

description: Cute little place with decent prices. Was searching on yelp for vegan and this place didn't come up.  After walking away from a more expensive organic place that advertised vegan on yelp, but could not accommodate, we went one door down and found this yummy diner. Ordered the vegetarian sandwich  (minus the meat and mayo), came with fries,  soup or salad. For $7.95. Can't usually find that kind of value anywhere near the pier. Good wait service too!
author: Katheryn W.

description: Family of five. Added their own 15% tip. Uhhhhh. Huh?  A bit forward, fellas. Easy there, chipper. I would have left you 20%+ if you hadn't done that. Two breakfast items out of 5 ordered they didn't have. One thing they were out of was chocolate milk for my little guy. When the pancakes came, they arrived with chocolate syrup.  You know, the kind you use to make.... wait for it.... chocolate milk.  Had to ask twice for the juice I ordered and twice for coffee refills. They weren't even particularly busy. Mexican style scramble was good and hash browns were good and crispy. The end.
author: Matt F.

description: Great food and service. We went for breakfast and had pancakes and eggs which were both great. Also went back for lunch and had the BLT and Clubhouse sandwiches. Both were great. I would recommend this place.
author: Tori D.

description: We stumbled upon this little gem on our most recent weekend getaway to San Francisco. It was perfect! Not too crowded. Great selection of breakfast and not too over priced. We both orders back and eggs with sourdough toast. Delicious the bacon was cooked perfectly. We liked it so much we went back the next morning. We will defiantly be making this a breakfast tradition when visiting the city again.
author: Michelle D.

description: Incredibly good breakfast. Feels like a classic diner. One of the best breakfast burritos ever.  Good value      Especially for the tourist area.
author: Marshall H.

description: We had a nice breakfast here. It's just a short stroll from the Zephyr Hotel where we lived. Nice food nice service too. We will recommend this place to friends n relatives.
author: Suria N.

description: Omelette and Belgian waffles tasted good! Only problem with this place is finding a parking spot close by.
author: Paul M.

description: Good food nice services I really recommend this place and it's so close to fishermen district
author: Sal M.

description: We have been coming here every time we visit SF for 7+years, Just now getting around to writing a review. We love this place. Great food, wonderful staff, and great service. Very pet friendly on their patio, they always bring out water for our companion. They are very attentive, and are such nice people, we make this place a must stop several times a year.  A small, quaint place, nice little park across the street. Perfect little breakfast joint, with a great menu.
author: Stevie W.

description:
I wanted a nice casual brunch, and that is exactly what I got.
I ordered pancakes, eggs, bacon, and a beer.  It arrived promptly and was delicious.
The staff were friendly and attentive, and the prices very reasonable.
If I lived in the neighborhood, this would be a regular spot for me.
author: Todd G.

description:
This diner is located in a great area close to Ghirardelli Square, so makes a good place to start your day if you're out walking about.

I ordered a big breakfast since I was spending the day running along the Marina and across the Golden Gate Bridge. Started with a short stack of two blueberry pancakes, followed by some eggs and bacon (and an English muffin and potatoes). I finished off the eggs, bacon, and pancakes, and felt full and satisfied. All of my food was good, although the couple pieces of potato I had could've used a bit more flavor.

The service here is totally worth the trip. I appreciate good customer service and the wait staff here gets it right. How can you not want to smile back and be a little chatty with them? :-)
author: John H.

description: Great service.  Great food.  It will be our regular breakfast place whenever we visit San Francisco.
author: Kim G.

description: We were looking for a breakfast place near our hotel in fishermans wharf. After checking the yelp reviews we settled on Joanie's. We split the waffle special and ordered a side of the country potatoes. Everything was excellent. Service was perfect.
author: Debra A.

description:
Useless Facts - Tram 101

I love...
+ breakfast (I can eat breakfast at every meal and everyday)
+ I love waffles, pancakes, omelets, crepes, French toasts, bacon, corned beef, etc.
+ I usually order: corned beef hash, chicken fried steak, or an omelets of some sort
+ I love diners; I prefer American cuisine over others
+ I'm a fan of big portions at a reasonable price
+ I like to pay no more than $12 for a breakfast plate 
+ I love quick and friendly service, more on quick but pretend to care at least
+ I love biscuits and gravy but I order it like once a year (super ass fattening)
+ I have been to just about every breakfast spots in San Jose, CA
+ I'm craving a 16oz. New York steak, cooked rare w/ the seasonings made by... 
+ Likes to be seated outdoors and this place has it - I love people watching

This place has an extensive menu.  It's not a place if you are on a tight budget but the prices are rather decent.  I paid $12 something + tax for my entree.  I ordered the corned beef benedict w/ country potatoes.  Granted, I felt like a fatty after I cleaned the plate but I left very satisfied.  The corned beef wasn't salty as most, the biscuits held well even after the hollandaise sauce and egg yolks made a pool, and the hollandaise sauce was thick and creamy... needed a touch of lemon juice but otherwise awesome.  The country potatoes were cooked to my liking: crispy on the edges and tender once you plop it in your mouth.  

Ugh.. this restricted diet is hard but I can do it.
author: Tram N.

description: The only reason this place has 4 stars is because some bitter person walked in, unfortunately. 5 stars for sure, I mean just look at the pictures.
author: Victor C.

description: 2nd time back here for breakfast. Conveniently located across courtyard fishermen wharf. Quiet and the coffee is good. Looks like a local favorite. Familiar customers talking shop with staff. Nice place. Portions are large. Prices are comparable to places like Sears fine food on Powell. Photos everywhere of their dishes for tourists. Had the sausage egg and cheese bagel with hash browns. Love how they cook the hash browns, making it thin and crispy.
author: Khiang S.

description: If i could give a negative star i would! Worst clam chowder ever super thick, salty and absolutely NO clams! I WOULD NEVER COME BACK NOR RECOMMEND TO ANYONE! AVOID
author: Marvin E.

description:
The food is excellent and very well prepared. You are a breakfast lover this place is for you. The prices are very good. You get a large amount of food for the prices you pay.

They also have an excellent lunch menu from sandwiches to burgers. My favorite one is the Patty Melt. They have another location call "Eight Am" is absolute worth the visit.
author: Christine K.

description: The food is good but not as good as the price you pay for it unless you don't mind dropping 80 bucks for breakfast for 4 ppl.  The dishes are old. Out of rye bread.  They add gratuity even though she he service is not worth it.
author: Arsalan K.

description:
I absolutely love this place! This is the best place for breakfast or lunch right before the beach. It's located in Fisherman's Wharf but not too close to where all the tourist usually are. Their prices are fair for the enormous, filling portions. 

I ordered the Belgian waffle topped with fruits and the fish tacos. The waffle was warm and had the perfect crisp. The fruits were fresh and went well with the waffle. The fish in the tacos were so fresh and lightly fried to perfection. I'm drooling just thinking about them again. 

This is a place everyone must try! Great food along with great service!
author: Natalie J.

description: This place was amazing on all scales.  The service was amazing and friendly. The hobo scramble was spectacular. The combination omelette was to die for. The chorizo omelette was perfectly blended. Even the simplest fried eggs and bacon were fabulous. The wait was not crazy it was like 10 minutes. Plenty of food ! Love this gem.
author: Patricia M.

description: Great service and breakfast , would come back. I had an omlette , would definitely try the breakfast sandwhich next time.
author: Aaron R.

description:
When we visited in August 2013, we ate breakfast here every day. We were referred by our hotel so we received a ginormous strawberry waffle for free. 

Food was perfect. Outdoor seating was great too. (There are only two or three tables, but it makes for a nice environment if you can snatch one.)

Over the course of three days, the four of us tried the bagels, eggs, and everything in between. Would recommend anything on their menu. 

Two years later and I can still remember that the chai tea was exactly to my liking and I could not have asked for anything more.
author: Jessica L.

description: This place is so cute ! it's kind of hidden but it's the 1st floor of a two story building. The servers are all very friendly and they provide great service - this place is the perfect breakfast spot.
author: Megan T.

description: We found Joanie's by accident; we were originally headed to Mama's but there was no way in hell I was gonna wait in that line... not a bad decision in the end. The joint seemed a little unorganized at first, maybe our party of seven threw them off their game, but, the boys in there quickly recovered. I ordered the two egg breakfast and it was so much food. Others in my party were happy with their meals as well; the corned beef hash, banana nut waffle and especially my niece who got a huge strawberry milkshake... I did have one little problem with this place, the loud lady who was gossiping and talking about other people's business- I don't need to hear all that, keep it on the low and chat it up when your customers are gone. Other than that, all was good. 3.5 stars.
author: Maryella P.

description: Nice menu. Friendly at first. When we got our drinks the sodas were all flat and tasted watered down. Went in to cancel our order. The manager was quick to make us us pay for the beverages that we did not drink nor enjoy. Since the beverages and service were this bad I'm glad we didn't try the food and be dissatisfied any further. We threw $10 on the table and left.
author: Danny N.

description:
* Stopped in here recently for breakfast on the way out of town, and it was nice! I would recommend it.

* Food was good! Normal breakfast/lunch diner fare, prepared well and quickly. There are also some good vegetarian options on the menu, which I love. I got the veggie scramble with their breakfast potatoes which were AWESOME.

* Everyone working there was super attentive and friendly!

* Very reasonable prices for the (generally expensive) area it's in.

* This is a small place (I'd estimate maybe 15 tables and bar seating? Not 100% sure.) and it's not fancy or anything, but it's clean, bright, and well-kept! I really liked the plain, casual diner atmosphere and felt comfortable (despite the fact that I was eating there alone!).

* Great location near the wharf. Totally safe, touristy area. There is convenient nearby street parking and several public lots in the area.
author: Lindsay R.

description: Great food.  Great staff. I got the French toast special with a hot chocolate. Great breakfast for the cold weather!!
author: Michael Y.

description: Get the breakfast tacos!!!! Amazing service and even better food. My coffee was never below half way because they were so attentive! Highly recommend
author: Ryan L.

description: This is a tasty little hole in the wall. In a cute area of SF and has pokestops!
author: Steph R.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and popped in on a Sunday.  Easy to get a table and my omelette was incredible.  Friendly service too.
author: Cyrus U.

description: My family and i came in here around 10 in the morning. I ordered eggs, bacon, and hash browns.  It was good except the hash browns were bland. The cheeseburger though is one of the best burgers around. The prices were okay and the seating outside was pleasant. The inside was less than stellar. The decor wasn't nice and the service was subpar. It seemed as though the waiter didn't know what was on the menu and wasn't attentive. Overall it was an average diner.
author: Emma W.

description: Fantastic little hole in the wall.  Our breakfast platters were huge and fabulous.  Great value and very personable service.  A little off the beaten path which we love.
author: Sharon L.

description: Went here because it was close to where we were staying and it had great reviews, maybe it was an off day for them.  My eggs Benedict were a disappointment, the sauce was bland and and barely covered the eggs, the bottom of the muffins were wet as if they had been sitting in water  and the ham slices had a strange flavor.  The side of hash browns appeared to be frozen out of a box.  Service was not spectacular and the waiter appeared to be either board or tired.
author: Scott D.

description: Perfect omelette with a cup of fresh fruits and a latte ... nice service and quickly served
author: Pierre E.

description:
A great breakfast!!!  I sat at the bar and was served on by a fellow Cleveland CAVS fan.  I had the eggs and corned beef hash.  Speedy and delicious.  The place was jammed and I was taken care of by a great staff.  Juice and water were always filled and they got me in and out quick.

Worth the wait
author: Mike B.

description: I work around the corner from Joanie's.  When I don't have time to eat breakfast at home, I will call in an order.  They open at 7AM - so it's convenient because my shift starts early.  The service is always attentive and quick with my order.  I can speak for the breakfast sandwiches and the breakfast burritos.  They are always good, tasty, hearty and a good value for what you pay.  I highly recommend Joanie's Happy Days Diner!
author: R F.

description: Great little dinner!  The staff was super nice and attentive.  The food was great.  Fast service, great food and nice people.  Can't beat that!
author: Pam M.

description:
Didn't expect this to be good for some reason, but it ended up pretty good. Food here is tasty and well priced. And by well priced I mean cheap, which is pretty unusual considering this spot is almost on fishermans wharf, has cool outdoor seating and coffee that keeps on coming. Yum!

Went here with a friend and had a nice time and nice food. Great spot to go after a wild night out. I had a tasty french toast with added strawberries and delicious cloudy whipped cream that tasted dreamy. And looked like a cloud. Everything tasted extra good because I was so starving.

I would definitely come here again. Yummy good food, but not memorable enough to get 5 stars. Its good but not great. But I like. If I was in the area and didn't want to wait in line at Mamas I'd come here. Which is essentially what I did.
author: Laima K.

description: The breakfast is soooooo good. I had the waffle and it was so incredibly fresh. It's a small, somewhat hidden location and it looks shady from the outside, but the service and food were spectacular. This place is the breakfast go-to for sure, and the prices were extremely reasonable for all the food you get. Presentation was equally impressive.
author: Hannah S.

description: This place is awesome! The food is amazing!! The pancakes melt in your mouth. The short stack is huge - I don't know how I would have eaten a regular portion. My husband ordered the California omelet, which was recommended by our waiter. He loved it! We sat outside and the weather was perfect. Definitely will be back on our next trip to San Francisco!
author: tara g.

description:
Really enjoyed this little spot.

I ordered the French toast with eggs, bacon, and a side of toast. The French toast was really good. My only complaint is that my bacon and eggs were cold when arriving to the table. I was hungry so I didn't care much at the time. My boyfriend ordered the breakfast burrito with sausage and bacon, so good! We both couldn't stop eating each other's food. 

Our server was extremely friendly :)
author: Addy L.

description:
After asking a staff member at the nearby courtyard Marriott where I was staying. 
"Where is a good place for a nice breakfast"?
He pointed to this little place across the street. He said he went there for lunch often so that was good enough for me. 
It was good enough for breakfast 2 mornings in a row and would have went more often if I could. 
Morning 1. Omelette with the works. Which ended up being too large to finish. 
Morning 2. Eggs Benedict. Which was the perfect portion. 
The waiter remembered that I couldn't finish the omelette from the day before. 
Both meals were excellent. Just what a guy wanted for breakfast so far from home!
author: Trevor B.

description: I'm local, but when I am the city, this is my go-to place, especially for breakfast. It's family owned and very convenient to the Wharf area. The staff are so giving and attentive. The servings are huge and tasty. It's a small place so you are not part of a big cattle call. I love these little places!
author: Karen W.

description: Awesome breakfast!  Beautiful pancakes and my kids loved it.  All the staff was super nice.
author: Leanne S.

description: Pretty good food. Tons of people there. I wanted to go to the breakfast place a couple doors down but the wait was to long so we went here. Nice staff. I like how they kept filling our water and asking if we needed anything. A lot of places when they are busy they never come back to fill up your water or coffee.
author: T C.

description: Lots of choices even for the pickiest of eaters. They have the basic eggs and bacon kinda meals to dishes that you wouldn't find at your local Ihop or Denny's like the Dungeness Crab Benedict. Ordered it and loved it. Our server was great and the food was delicious. Will be back next trip to SF!
author: Kat T.

description: This place is horrible. Don't waste your time.  We wondered why there was no wait.  Sat down and ordered drinks.  I asked for water and got a coffee and my guests ordered a coke and root beer and they were both watered down and flat.  So we got up and told them we changed our mind.  They still made us pay for the drinks.  Even though we only took a sip. Bad service.
author: Pookie P.

description: A very good place for breakfast! Michael was an awesome server and super friendly! I had the biscuits and gravy and it definitely was just as I hoped. My wife loves the country style potatoes. A nice short walk from our hotel and super close to the wharf. A must-go place!
author: James N.

description: Awesome little hole in the wall cafe with seating both inside and out on the sidewalk. They serve breakfast and lunch, but we have only had breakfast there. First day I had the 'Joey's tacos' and my husband had an omelet.  Portions are large, so next time we shared the 'Joey's breakfast tacos' then shared a waffle. Everything we had was great and the service was fast and friendly. The crab eggs benedict looked awesome but we had burnt ourselves out on seafood and wanted something different. Eat here! You won't be disappointed!
author: Deborah P.

description: I'm full but somehow not satisfied. The presentation was ok. Taste was fine but served not quite hot enough. Value - too pricy as I would compare them to a Denny's or iHop. One family member owns this for over 12 years and the other family member owns 8am. Virtually next door. We went there yesterday and I wish we would have returned today. Jonies I think has forgotten what has kept them in business for so long. Quality, value, taste and a staff that should be a little more service oriented.  If your looking for standard American breakfast. This is it. Keep your fingers crossed for taste and quality. You won't find value.
author: Tami K.

description:
The staff was exceptionally friendly and the prices were reasonable.  Two full meals and coffee, which they kept refilled without having to flag them down, came to $30 before tip.  All family and very family oriented.  There was a table of about 8 kids and two adults that were celebrating a birthday.  The way the staff interacted with them was great.  They made a waffle creation and put a candle on it for the birthday boy. 

I was disappointed they were out of biscuits and gravy. I ordered corned beef hash, instead.  Not good.  Not good at all.  Corned beef is one of my favorite things in the world and hash is amazing when made right, but something about canned hash.  It's just awful.

My boyfriend ordered the breakfast tacos (minus the lettuce).  Really good corn tortilla, eggs, cheese and chorizo.  mmmmmm.  I ate half of one of his and it was amazing.

Looking at other peoples dishes, it's apparent they specialize more in waffles and pancakes.  I'm not a fan of either, but each plate they brought out looked amazing.  

I would definitely recommend this place to someone staying in the area.  Just remember to avoid the corned beef hash!  And if you like chorizo and tacos...you MUST try them.  So good.  Otherwise, waffles and pancakes.
author: Shannon D.

description:
To be honest, I had my doubts about this place since it initially didn't look like anything special and is in the touristy Fisherman's wharf.

But lo and behold, it was amazing!

The fish tacos came with fries that was bursting with flavors. I've had my share of fish tacos from other places before and these fish tacos trump them all. The fries weren't crunchy and hard, they were the a bit crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Yummy!! The Crab Benedict was delicious as well, it was mixed with some sort of sauce and had the perfect consistency- not dry and not soggy. 

Come here! You won't regret it :)
author: Emily C.

description: The breakfast burrito was excellent and fairly large - I couldn't finish it. Good value for around $11. Service was good. Added bonus: no line on a Saturday morning. They have a pleasant seating area off the sidewalk and a fair amount of seating inside. Check this place out.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Small place just off of Columbus and North Point.  We were staying at a local hotel, but decided to go for a walk and find some place to eat.  Stumbled on this spot.  They have some out door seating, but we choose to eat inside.  I had your basic bacon and egg breakfast, and my wife had eggs with corned beef hash.  Both were standard and good, everything was cooked as expected.  The place has a diner feel to it with tables and a bar.  

All good, not spectacular, but solid.  Prices were about average.  I would eat here again.
author: Russell B.

description: We ended up here after getting a Groupon, although the pricing wasn't bad anyway - about $9 for a burger and fries. The staff is very nice. The place is clean. And the food is worth coming back for!  We had hamburgers. They were served on large, freshly baked, lightly grilled buns with fresh lettuce and tomato. The dries were crisp and hot with more than we could finish (my husband and I should have shared a meal!). We will absolutely return. :)
author: Jackie C.

description: My boyfriend and I have been in San Francisco for 4 days and have already had breakfast here twice. Sooo good. The first day I got a Mexican scramble with potatoes, and today got country fried steak with scrambled eggs. Boyfriend got the breakfast burrito. Their potatoes are life. Their sausage gravy is life. Honestly thinking about having breakfast here again tomorrow before we leave. Service is prompt and friendly also.
author: Cory D.

description:
An unassuming place from the outside, but the breakfast was terrific. Lots of choices, and the quantity of the food was substantial. I had a cheese and mushroom omelette, and there were a LOT of mushrooms. Plus, the service was as good as the food--very attentive and quick with the coffee refills.

We'll definitely be back next time we're in San Francisco!
author: Jim P.

description:
Where to begin.. 
Let's see here.. Bachelor party weekend.. Tired, just want breakfast, Buena Vista was full.. So we look and decide to trust yelp to come on over to Joanies. 

We sit down at a 3/4 full restaurant at about 10a on 4/10.  (Take note business owner, so you know who to point your fingers to)    Staff seems nice enough trying to accommodate our party of 6.  The take our drink orders which we order a round of waters that NEVER come until speak about it three times.   We get our coffee, espresso, oj, milkshake and it was fine but nothing special.  This in itself does not lower the yelp stars but doesn't help it. 

We order all of our food and when I ask country potatoes or hash browns, they say hash is way better.   I should of looked on peoples' plates eating around us because it's nothing more than frozen potatoes folks.    The food all comes out at random times for everyone.. At no point are they able to serve 2 meals at the same time.  First, the sammy comes out, club I think.. Nothing to write home about.. 15 minutes later, biscuits and gravy for another person.. 20 minutes after that, pancakes and another persons breakfast burrito.   15 minutes after that, omelettes. 

ARE YOU GUYS COOKING ON ONE SINGLE HOT PLATE? Seriously, the servers there NEVER asked how we were doing or if we needed anything because they KNEW that they didn't have our food ready.  They didn't even want to make eye contact.   Refills on coffee rarely came,   food never came out hot.. And to top it all off, they gave my food to another one of my buddies and were told it was the other omelette. So now I have my buddy eating my food, it's been almost an hour and there is still one person without food.. 

RIDICULOUS.. 

4 stars? are y'all out of your mind?  think about it, frozen potatoes, poor service, SF prices.. Umm yeah. This is not good any way you look at it.
author: Ray W.

description: Went here three days of our vacation! Amazing breakfast! The hash brown Benedict and the biscuits and gravy are amazing. Joanie is here everyday and runs this place like a well oiled machine. Not fancy like the Buena Vista but far better service, food and pricing
author: Paul G.

description:
The food was good. Little pricy but good. The restaurant has nothing to do with the show happy days.
Our waitress was so young she didn't really know there was a show called happy days.
author: Marc E.

description: Great service, friendly staff, yummy food! We came here on a Saturday and I was expecting our food to take forever but it came out quickly! Would definitely come back if I lived in the area.
author: Sydney N.

description:
Pricing is pricy but this is the wharf and tourists do frequent here.

Food is great! Staff are nice! I am a regular and they know what I want before I order.

Joanie is very friendly and took the time to come over and ask me how my meal was.

Took my boyfriend here and he loves it.

Been coming here for a year now. Came because I work right next door.
author: Taylor E.

description: We loved this place for breakfast.  Not too long of a wait and it moves fast if there is a line. Week days are the best time to go.  I had the Belgian waffle with fruit one day and it was very good. They are big enough to share. I also had waffle special another day, waffle,2 eggs,bacon, or sausage.  One day it was 2 eggs with English muffins. I tried several things on the menu and all were good. My husband  had their 3 egg omelette and said they were  so delicious. We were there 6 days and had breakfast at Joanies 5 days. You must go! I almost forgot, the staff is so friendly!  Most of them are family and one of the girls working there is so funny she makes you feel like you have know her forever.
author: Darleta P.

description: I stopped by here for a solo breakfast while I was in town for work. The Fat Crab and Eggs (eggs benedict with crab instead of canadian bacon) was a solid dish, but it didn't blow my socks off. The service was just okay. Overall I enjoyed my breakfast and I'd head back to Joannie's in the future.
author: Jessi M.

description: Very nice people.  Breakfast was delicious! Walking distance from Marriott.  Will go again when I'm back in town.
author: Shannon B.

description: Very expensive, coffee was terrible!  Went to Starbucks for my caffeine fix.  Not good service. Disappointed with it overall.
author: Wendy B.

description:
My wife and I had a great breakfast here. The staff was super nice and really accommodating with our food order. The portions were huge and were done really well. 

From the outside, I may not have stopped in, but thanks to apps like Yelp, I was confident we'd have a good meal. We will absolutely add Joanie's to our San Francisco routine!
author: Fred M.

description:
3.5 stars, actually.  This little breakfast place is near Fishermans Wharf, the Marriott and Holiday Inn Express.  If you'd rather go local, not Denny's, Joanies will not disappoint.  It is a family place that has a good breakfast served by a group of cheerful staffers in a clean, bright space.  

The waffles and the hobo plate (scrambled eggs with spinach, potatoes, etc) are especially good.  We ate here twice in one week, and the second time my friend's order got messed up.  My colleague ordered corned beef hash with hash browns well done.  The kitchen served him well done corned beef hash and hash browns.  He considered sending back the hash browns to be cooked to crispy perfection, but it really wasn't worth the trouble.  It could happen anywhere, but you may want to be very clear about your order.

Oatmeal was average, and coffee was just ok.  Prices are consistent with what you'd expect in a touristy area.

You won't find anything special here except the service, but Joanies offers consistent breakfast fare in a warm, friendly environment.  I wonder if Joanie still loves Chachie.
author: Edward W.

description:
This place doesn't look like a great restaurant. The entrance is less catchy than other disneyland-like places near fisherman's wharf. 

However you should go in and stop for lunch if you're in the neighborhood. This place is a typical American style restaurant. Nothing really fancy on the menu, but the food is great, and waiters are cheerful. 
I had a good time there, my stomach was satisfied, and so was my wallet!
author: Arnaud B.

description:
STAY AWAY!!! There is no way any of the positive reviews were written by customers.
This place is the worst breakfast I've EVER had. Totally over priced and the food quality is terrible. Avoid eating here. Paid $38 for two adult breakfasts consisting of two eggs, toast, one with corned beef hash, one with sausage. Both with coffee. One portion of a children's pancake. The hash was from a can, fried on the griddle and served paper thin, toast had margarine, and the eggs were luke warm. The menu has pictures of the food which should have been a red light, the menu photos look nothing like what appears on the website.
author: Jeffrey J.

description: I had their breakfast tacos. They were SUPER good, however since that was the only thing I had eaten, by lunch time my breakfast was coming back up :( this also continued till the next day. This place seems good but for 15$ for some tacos and food poisoning it wasn't worth it.
author: Mariah A.

description:
The service here was good, the people were very nice and the food arrived quickly. And the coffee wasn't bad either.

The food... I wish we had gone down the street to Denny's. Ok they eggs were cooked well, but out of 5 meals that was the only thing. May have been the worse pancakes both my daughter and I ever had. My son who eats EVERYTHING absolutely hated the corned beef hash.

I would never give a bad review based of one visit if so many things were not so bad.
author: Brian A.

description: Great place down by the wharf with outdoor seating.  The food is good and hearty, and the service was friendly and good as well!  We had the veggie breakfast burrito and it came with green salsa, pico de gallo and sour cream, very good and filling!
author: Julie S.

description:
Tried to go to Hollywood Cafe, this turned out better. They easily sat 13 people, gave GREAT mimosas, awesome customer service, and I would totally come back. 

I got the Biscuits and Gravy and was extremely happy with it.
author: Brandon J.

description: Decent menu. Food was fresh and good portion. Service was good. Only unfortunate part was the location. There is a small park directly in front of it where several homeless congregated. One in particular was disruptive during our meal.
author: Sarina F.

description: Update. The people that work here are just fantastic. So is the food. I highly recommend this place for anyone that visits or lives here.
author: Rob T.

description: We thought the food was really good here, the kids breakfast pancakes combo is great.  My husband had the berry waffle, and I had the vegetarian breakfast burrito.  My burrito came out with bacon in it, but they told me as they were giving it to me.  It was my choice to keep it.  We thought the prices were high.  $10.95 for a waffle and berries?   It is San Francisco, though!!!
author: Stacey T.

description:
I would have given five stars but the coffee is crap and coffee is king for breakfast.  In a city like San Francisco you gotta go big.  

I usually don't like places with photos of the food everywhere.  But the quality was good and the people friendly.

Great service.  Good food.  Fast service too.  I'd recommend for any travelers staying in the wharf area.
author: C M.

description:
During a late summer trip to SF, we accidentally found this place because it was downstairs from the apartment we were renting.  We ended up eating here 4 of the 5 mornings we were in the city, and actually liked the food better than the famous Mama's on Washington Square (which we found horribly overrated, but that's another story.)

It's not fancy.  It's a hole-in-the-wall, mom-and-pop style casual cafe, but the breakfasts we had were AMAZING (hence why we came back so much).  Reasonably priced, fast service, clean-looking.  My particular favorite was the breakfast sandwich on a fresh croissant, with home style potatoes on the side (Hey, I never said it was healthy...) and an iced coffee.  The omelets and hash browns were great, too, as was my friend's french toast.  Portions were very large, and prices were pretty low.
