Higher than fast food, cheaper than many of the sit-down, full-service restaurants in the area.  If I'm back in the city, I'll be here for breakfast, and I would highly recommend it.  Can't speak on the lunch menu, since we never tried it.  I don't think they're open for dinner.
author: AJ J.

description: The staff here is just too nice! Breakfast was delicious - nearly missed the Biscuits & Gravy on their menu, which was hiding in their menu listed almost blocked by a photo. So glad I spotted it, because wow! Had a great cappuccino and we loved sitting on the sidewalk watching the host inviting passers by to come in for breakfast. (He was really good and had a ridiculous success rate... He was also fun to talk with too.) Very reasonable for the neighborhood and the portions!
author: Amy N.

description:
Well bfast is bfast I guess.  Eggs were....eggs.  Hashbrowns sucked.  Dry and tasted like oil it was fried in.

French toast was good.  Wife said pancakes were good.  

Surprised no turkey selections.

Came recommended on YELP.  Had great pictures posted.  Again, small place.
author: Tom C.

description:
I had a great experience here.  They do not have zoned serving areas so all of the waitstaff was attentive.  We went midweek later in the morning so there wasn't a full restaurant. While we were looking over the menu different servers visited us three times to see if we were ready.  During the meal we got checked on a couple times.  

I ordered the crab and spinach benedict, it was delicious.  My friend ordered the french toast and eggs combo and didn't have any complaints.  The one thing to be cognizant of, the prices are on the high end.  We ended up spending $37 on breakfast (no alcohol ordered).  They served a quality meal, but if you are looking for something quick and cheap there are other restaurants in the area to meet your needs.
author: Jessica J.

description:
Nothing wrong with this diner. It's pretty standard. Restaurant space is kinda small. Service is okay. Staff is friendly. Food is good, but I feel like the prices are a tad higher than the average diner. 

Probably wouldn't come back though because it's out of my way and I've found other diners I enjoy more for less money.
author: Abigail D.

description: Corn beef and eggs was so good I cried tears of glory.
author: John B.

description:
I loved this place. Super friendly and delicious. I came to try Coffee adventures next door but it was closed in the middle of the afternoon. Joanni was open and welcomed us right away. The Denver omellete was huge and the country potatoes were many. The guys working there kept giving me lots of coffee so i loved them all ^_^ 

Thanks you guys.
author: Enkhee N.

description: Was in the mood for an omelette so decided to stop in on the 1st day off vacation. My girls are still sleeping in the room and i need my time. Saw they had eggs Benedict so decided i would give it a go. Switched from the omelette. They also do Florentine Benny so mixed the traditional together. Service upon entering was fast and courteous. I was however told i can't sit at the front tables as they are for large parties and i was by myself. The couple behind me took the"large"table. There were many others available. Good came and was well plated. Eggs just the slightest overdone but acceptable. Muffin perfect as the spinach. Hash browns perfect. I'll go get the girls and bring em back. The only thing is i haven't seen the waiter since he brought my food! I hope i can get a check because they are filling up fast!
author: Ed G.

description: Had breakfast for lunch (which is a plus in my book when breakfast is served all day)!  I had the ham/spinach scramble w/ hash browns and English muffin- yum!  Tasted great, portions just right!  The wait staff was cheerful and serviced our table frequently despite having a fairly large lunch crowd.  My wife had the corned beef hash eggs benedict which was delicious!  A must stop when in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: CJ K.

description: Breakfast was great! Server was friendly and food was ready fast! I would recommend the biscuits and gravy!
author: Leah C.

description: Very expensive and food was average (too much of it too). Split meals unless you want to overeat or waste food. Wish we had eaten at "8 AM" instead.  Wait staff friendly.
author: jim l.

description: Great breakfast!! We were going to go to Hollywood cafe but the Valet guy at the argonaut told us about this place. We got there around 8 (sleep in? What's that?! We have a 1 and 3 year old) and got say right away outside. The waiter was new but nice. Service wasn't perfect but the food made up for it!! This is a gem that's tucked away! Eat here!
author: Christina P.

description: Every time I come to this place, they always welcome me! The service is excellent and they make the food perfect every time I go. I had the chocolate waffles to go and when I opened it, I was surprised how great it was and I couldn't finish it but I wish I could have
author: Sierra H.

description:
We loved this spot so much,  we ate breakfast there every day of our San Francisco visit.  It is located just down the street from The Columbus Motor Inn ( another recommendation).

Their menu has a great range of items to satisfy everything from the lightest appetite to early morning hunger.  Great fruit, waffles and French toast.  Our friend really enjoyed his corn beef hash, one of his favorite meals when prepared well.

Fast service and very reasonable prices for the city.
author: Beverly K.

description: Food was not very good, service was about the same--we could barely hear our waiters (2 people were helping us for some reason, and they were both meek) and our coffees were empty when the food came out but didn't ever get refilled, and then we were overcharged on our bill.
author: Steph D.

description: The food is absolutely hideous.  The wait was long for the place next door and so we decided to give this place a try. I had the Hobo plate. After a couple of bites I immediately felt sick to my stomach. My wife had the Benedict and thought it was mundane. This is the first and only place we tried in SF that served bad food. Very disappointing. Extremely low quality food.
author: Vivian M.

description: Great place to get a quick bite to eat before going on a bus tour or walk the pier. Great service with delicious food.
author: Herb M.

description: Belgium banana nut waffle and Joanie's milkshake! Oh my delicious! We will b back again during our visit in SF. Friendly staff and sidewalk seating. An enjoyable stop for good and people watching and relaxing.
author: D W.

description: This place is amaaaazing. Their staff is extremely nice and always made sure we were well taken care of. My water glass was never empty (always a plus for me). We went a little past noon, which is why we didn't wait at all but I hear this place always gets packed. I ordered the belgian waffle with strawberries, delicious. We also had a custom made omelette, pretty much put everything in there. Also delicious. If you're in the neighborhood, swing by & have some breakfast!
author: Cara N.

description: Basic American breakfast fare a short walk from the waterfront.  Service was friendly and attentive.
author: Steve S.

description: Took a chance and bought a Groupon for this diner for our trip to San Francisco.  Our hotel was across the street.  It's just a hole in the wall but the staff was very nice and attentive.  I had sausage omelet with excellent country potatoes.  My son had French toast combo.  He said it was really good and that's a lot coming from him.  I would highly recommend this place!
author: Amber S.

description: This diner has an extremely friendly staff. And...yep, that's where the positives end. The food was absolutely bland. The decor was hardly decor - basically four walls with cheap furniture. The coffee was bitter. PASS.
author: Jacky J.

description: Looking for a breakfast place with my two young kids and this place worked.   We sat outside to not bother other diners(only ones outside) but the waitress did not forget about us, which is what often happens.  Had the chicken fried steak and eggs, both done perfectly.   Decent prices for the location and couldn't ask for a better waitress.  Just what we needed
author: Josh K.

description:
Rainy days.

Skies were delivering some much needed precipitation. Stepping into Joanie's was as much because of hunger as a need to stay dry.

Greeted by the friendly staff I was given a table right next to the window. Perfect for watching the rain while staying out of it. Sunny days must be nice too.

Rain was falling fast. Unfortunately at Joanie's the prices need to fall fast too.

Suppose this is to be expected with tourist location. But no matter how much I liked my Belgium waffle topped with (about 75% of what the picture shows) bananas or how much my Americano gave me life it was far from a $15 plus tip.

Burgers look good and more reasonably priced. They might get another chance on a future rainy day.
author: Jason B.

description:
Corned beef hash Benedict!!

The thing I love about staying at Fisherman's Wharf area versus downtown/Financial District area is the fact that you can actually find restaurants open for breakfast.

The breakfast here was exceptional - I'm a bacon and eggs breakfast kind of guy.  Every time I try something else, whether it's what they're known for or not, I regret it.  I decided to venture out again, and I'm glad I did.  Great combination that I wouldn't ever consider making for breakfast myself.

I sat outside because for once it was a sunny and beautiful morning, although the temperatures were in the 50's.  I had a beautiful view of construction on Columbus Ave...hopefully that's gone soon.  But the 3 staff members that spoke to me at one time or another were all smiles and made the entire meal very enjoyable.  My coffee was never empty, food piping hot.  I will definitely be back to try some of the other delicious items.
author: Nick G.

description: Whenever we are in San Francisco we are always coming here for a breakfast.  Food is delicious, service is outstanding and prices are also good. Salmon benedict is very good and vegetables burrito is owesome.  We strongly recommend this place to anyone.
author: Victoria M.

description: Good place, they were out of yogurt and cottage cheese.  Pancakes were good but no Nashville Pancake Pantry if you've been there.  Would recommend but not a must go.
author: Kyle W.

description: Joanie's owned and run by a very friendly Asian family.  From the moment you stepped in, you're greeted right away and being seated, luckily I didn't have to wait long at all.  The menu is well diverse with lots to chose from breakfast to lunch to lighter options.  I had the bagel with bacon and egg, no cheese- it was delish!  I also requested to have my hash brown extra cook and it was made to perfection.  The boy had a chocolate waffle w/ strawberry and it came out beautifully.  The food tastes delicious, staff were extremely attentive and quick, overall, I would love to come back here every weekend for breakfast.  Get here early because it gets packed quick!!!
author: Katie N.

description:
My husband and I shared a Ham and Spinach omelette.  We chose the hash browns.  Everything was cooked "just ok" but the flavor was "just like Denny's".   Based upon the high ratings, we were expecting so much more.  Perhaps we just ordered the wrong thing, but when we compare the omelette and hash browns to our favorite "Los Gatos Cafe", it's would be like comparing Spam to Kobe Beef.  


Service was 4 stars


Atmosphere was 3-4 stars.


Prices were $$.
author: Heather B.

description: Reasonably priced and breakfast was very good! Within walking distance of many hotels. While it's not much with ambiance, they make up with great food and a warm, friendly staff. I had a 3 egg, spinach, mushroom and jack cheese omelette. It came with choice of bread options, and a choice between house potatoes or hash browns. Good coffee but you have to keep asking for refills. I would defiantly come back to this place again.
author: Vikki E.

description: Best breakfast burrito ever...it's a nice little place and pleasant staff...I recommended when you come to San Francisco come here for breakfast...great place!
author: Elaine A.

description:
What stood out the most was great their customer service. Young folks in their college sweatshirts making sure you got everything your ordered. It felt really well-organized and well-run, and I really like that about restaurants, where you know things are top-notch in front and back of the house.

The food was delightful, but honestly nothing stood out for me. It definitely is one of the better breakfast/brunch spots in the touristy part of town, though.
author: Jen E.

description: After leaving the long lines of Hollywood Cafe we stumbled on this place - a really nice breakfast diner and no difficulty getting a seat. Fresh squeezed oj, strong coffee, and perfectly cooked eggs. Loved it.
author: Christopher A.

description:
This was a great spot for breakfast -- we enjoyed eating in the sunshine at one of their sidewalk tables on a recent visit to SF!  I found this place on yelp and decided to check it out -- the reviews are accurate and they do a great job at this diner! 

I had the crab cake benny and it was FANTASTIC!   Super fresh, made from scratch crab cake and perfectly cooked eggs.  Coffee was great too and the service was superb. 

Casual & comfortable, with a big menu and great food -- check it out if you need a great breakfast to start your day in SF!
author: Michael G.

description:
This place was right across the street from where we were staying and, since it had great reviews, we figured we'd come by for breakfast.

Got the crab benedict with home fries. The crab benedict was very good. The home fries were decent, but lacked seasoning and thought it was weird how they came out in a giant block (I'm used to New York diners so maybe it's like this elsewhere).

Overall a good meal.
author: Dave N.

description: Just finished breakfast here. Came up this street as there a few well rated places next to eachother. This one caught our eye as they had outdoor shaded seating. Breakfast sandwiches were $10 each, which I thought was just Cali wharf pricing. Then our sandwiches arrived, huge! We each took home half. I ordered the bacon, egg and cheese on sourdough. Hot and buttery with crisp bacon. Local business people were eating here also. Nothing new and interesting to eat (though there isn't sourdough at home), but a good experience.
author: C M.

description: Great place for breakfast. The service was fast and friendly. We have been on vacation for a month and trying to find a normal breakfast place was a challenge. This is definitely our go to place in the wharf area.
author: Bob M.

description: I'm a south Texas boy. Like me some breakfast tacos. The burrito here was a beautiful thing. Served Chipotle style in foil. It's all about the tortilla. Service was good. Large portions also. I'll be back.
author: Kevin M.

description: Great breakfast spot.  In between the Warf and Ghirardellis.   I had the breakfast tacos.  They were fantastic.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Craig C.

description:
After reading the reviews on Yelp I had to try this place for breakfast.  From the front door the greeter is waving and mailing and friendly and draws you into the place.  
It's not a big place at all, seating outside and inside but it's comfy.  The food was great!  Nice portions for the price, friendly staff.
Definitely recommend for breakfast!
author: Pauline L.

description: Seating is tight and limited, but the food and service are excellent. The country potatoes were just average, but my sausage/egg/cheese muffin was massive and tasty. My wife greatly enjoyed her meal (I think it was eggs and salmon). Servers are friendly and attentive. If you like local, hole-in-wall places with great food, you must try Joanie's!
author: Nathan R.

description:
Always packed but they turn tables fast! The Food will speak for itself and thats why they are busy. Service is family owned and they work hard, would be no suprise if they were all making six figures. They are outstanding in everyway, the place needs a remodel but who has time when the place is packed like it is!

Always enjoy this place everytime I come to the Wharf!
author: Allen C.

description: My experience was not a pleasant one, the food was not good... burger came and the bun was soaked and I couldn't hold it in my hands, hash browns was thin, and tasteless ... I'd not come back... Disappointed
author: Ryan T.

description: Terrable service. There were six of us the food came out 10 minuets apart. Never brought all of us our coffee. Messed up the order for several dishes. The food was just ok.
author: Jay B.

description: How this place has one single good review is beyond me!! The corned beef hash looked like somebody barfed on my plate. I couldn't even bring myself to put that in my mouth. My over easy eggs were barely warm; I couldn't bring myself to put a second bite in my mouth. The potatoes also barely warm were very bland; only two bites made it in. They use margarine instead of butter, they put American cheese in omlets! When I pushed my plate away after three bites they didn't even ask me what was wrong and made me pay full price!! This place is worse than the Bashful Bull in the Sunset!!!! Wish there was a zero star option or even better a negative star.
author: Robin W.

description: I had the corn beef hash and toast. Very tasty. My husband had the everything omelet. There was so much food he only ate half. Price was average for the city. I'd eat there again.
author: Hollis W.

description: Great place for breakfast. Had the breakfast burrito. It was amazing. Very big and stuffed with eggs bacon cheese and hash browns. I had them add country gravy to it and that just set it off. Highly recommend adding the gravy. Highly recommend eating here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Thomas C.

description:
We were on our way to another breakfast place and passed by Joanies, and decided to stop in. The owner was SUPER friendly, you can tell they are a local business, and our food was delish. 

It's a bit expensive for breakfast, but you are steps away from the Pier. We sat outside to enjoy the gorgeous San Fran morning and gorged ourselves on a huge breakfast. If you aren't super hungry, get one dish and split it.
author: Sumina B.

description:
K, this place had AWESOME pancakes. 

Yes I love pancakes, and these ones were awesome. This is also the first place we found with good fountain drinks. Much better than our first day getting bent over for can'd cola. 

all the food was great, and it was very reasonably priced. If you are looking for somewhere to eat breakfast, this is the best place in the area.

The service was great, and they put up with my kids. Can't ask for more than that.

They sealed the deal by giving us our soda in a to-go cup!
author: Denton S.

description: The best French toast I've ever had! Small and friendly. Skip the touristy restaurants and over priced food for a home cooked meal that is amazing. I wish I had found this place on my first day instead of my last but I am glad to have found it!
author: Angie B.

description: Good food is not normally enough for me to want to review but the OUTSTANDING service and welcoming atmosphere makes this place great. So happy to visit this spot!
author: Mrs. C.

description:
Went here because it received a four star review on Yelp and fell victim to the bane of social media...getting your friends to like you restaurant even though it's terrible.

The coffee was mediocre.  My wife would likely say awful but it wasn't that bad.

I had an bacon egg and cheese croissant.  The croissant was good, the bacon egg and cheese was not.  The only saving grace was the potatoes (not the hashbrowns).

Still, it gets one star to counteract all the false praise.
author: Mike P.

description: Staying in Fisherman's Wharf, yelped ''best breakfast", this came up, a short walk over, and boy, were we not disappointed!! Great food, great service, two visits from friendly owner/chef.  We had/split pancakes and the salmon scramble (highly recommended) and could not finish! And I'm a big eater! I want to come back....
author: Bert M.

description: Basic breakfast but very yummy. My husband and I were looking for breakfast and decided to try this place. It didn't disappoint. I had the French toast with sausages, scrambled eggs and hash browns while my husband had the eggs Benedict. My husband said his food was made "just the way (he) likes it". The bread they used for the French toast tasted really good and the hash browns were perfect. Would definitely go back.
author: Charles R.

description: Wonderful and friendly service. A visit to Joanie's is a must when you're in San Francisco.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Yes, this is in the middle of hard core tourist zone, but it is actually bomb! We sometimes stay at the HI down the street (one of the best hotel deals/locations in the city I think).

I got the burger with mushrooms and avocado and it was seriously delicious. I was really surprised by how yummy it was. My man got a breakfast omelet and it was huge and satisfying (so he claims, and I tried).

Actually, just writing this review right now is making me want the burger.... for a diner, it is clearly worth it. Clearly.
author: Rachel G.

description: Breakfast was quick and delicious.  Amazing blueberry pancakes.  No frills here, basic coffee.  But the service was friendly and it really hit the spot.  Extra points for the relatively low prices.
author: Andrea M.

description: Awesome food and service.  Not a tourist hot spot with great prices and large meal portions.
author: Patrick S.

description: Stopped in last weekend based on other people's reviews and the breakfast were fantastic! Server was super nice and attentive! My cousin ordered the Biscuit and Gravy and it is hands down the best Biscuit & Gravy I have ever had.  There was meat in the gravy! Delicious! I ordered the Bacon & Eggs combo and their hash browns are delicious!  Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Bren T.

description:
Great location and great food. 
Good size portions of food. 
Very reasonable prices for SF.
Very friendly people at this place. 
You can not go wrong if you eat here.
author: Bob M.

description: I loved the place. The location is beautiful as well as the food. Having breakfast outside in a sunny day was really delighful. I was never out of coffee and the waiters are very welcoming and helpful. I'll definitely go there again if I'm around.
author: Ahmed A.

description: I've been coming here for a couple of years now and it is still amazing - Joanie and her team continues with top-notch service and amazing food!
author: Ray L.

description: My famiy (3 adults) had both a breakfast and lunch here. The food for both meals was delicious and nicely presented. The service was very attentive. It is a local place that serves breakfast and lunch. The prices were very fair and there were good menu choices. We were very pleased and can see why the locals frequent this restaurant. We highly recommend Joanie's Happy Days Diner.
author: MC B.

description:
Great breakfast and lunch menu at lower price than hotels.
As good as it gets for casual breakfast in Fisherman's Warf.
author: Bruce F.

description: I had a Bacon omelet with American cheese. It had a slightly unusual flavor which I couldn't identify. My wife thought it had a slightly chemical taste, but I felt it may have been from the bacon flavoring... whatever it was it wasn't very good. The Hash browns were good. Blueberry pancakes very good. They used plenty of blueberries which was nice.  On the down side, they only provided a little pitcher of syrup.  They readily brought more upon request but why they thought that an ounce of syrup was enough for a full stack of pancakes, I can't imagine. The biggest problem was the toast. It was cold. I am not talking just slightly warm...I mean it was downright cold, so much so that the butter would not melt!  I suspect that they simply timed it wrong and let it sit for way too long.  Anyway, think this place has potential.  It was nice inside and the staff was very friendly. They just have some work to do.
author: Bill W.

description: Made reservation. Was told there were no tables and had to wait 10 mins. Fine. Then a walk in comes and is seated before us! Very unorganized. Food is ok, nothing special.
author: Carissa B.

description:
I just watched a worker touch the trash bin outside & then say a table, handling their utensils without washing his hands! YUCK!!
Food was subpar. I quickly made my way out after I saw that.
author: Renee W.

description: Skip the line at Hollywood Cafe, come to Joanie's. Great, fresh food. Friendly service. Two thumbs up.
author: Jerry W.

description: Nice quiet little diner worth the uphill trek from the wharf area. Crab Benedict was outstanding!!
author: Derek H.

description: We came here at the recommendation of our Hotel staff. They gave us a card for two free fruit bowls with breakfast. I expected the fruit to be wilted and soft, but NO. VERY fresh and tasty. Overall the inside of the restaurant looks very clean and the staff are very friendly. We were immediately greeted as we entered and seated. Our food came quickly, looked and tasted great. I would highly recommend this place for a "diner" type experience.
author: Mark H.

description: Great corn beef hash! I was surprised how great a selection they had. From the outside you would not expect anything special. We sat outside on a nice table. Staff was attentive and the food was served after a short period of time
author: Mark A.

description: We came to San Francisco for the weekend and had some terrible luck with restaurants since we got here. We stumbled upon this place, and thank god was did!! Everything was absolutely amazing! The french toast was perfect cooked and my boyfriends strawberry Belgian waffle was beyond beautiful and delicious. If you are ever in the area looking for a breakfast spot, this is the place to come! Not a long wait at all
author: Salina G.

description: You've taken the Cable Car to the wharf and now you need breakfast.  Look no further.  No frills American style breakfast with a friendly staff.  Eggs, hash browns, pancakes, breakfast burrito, or anything else one would expect at a diner.
author: Eli M.

description: Nice place for breakfast - the breakfast burritos are some of the best I have ever eaten! The only negative point is that it is a little pricey, especially when paying for 5 people. I would definitely come back, probably by myself next time, though.
author: Matt W.

description: My wife and I recently had breakfast at Joanie's Happy Days Diner after a nice, hilly walk around SF. We arrived hungry and in need of coffee. Joanie's coffee--while not Starbuck's / Peet's / fill in your favorite--was hot and fresh and flavorful and set the table for a really nice breakfast. My wife had the Belgian Waffle with (lots of) fruit and I had the Breakfast Burrito with Chorizo. Both came up pretty quickly, and were very tasty. The restaurant was clean, the service was polite and attentive (but not overly so), and the cost was reasonable for a pretty touristy area. The ultimate question: would we return? Yes!
author: Bill F.

description: Fisherman's Wharf is full of tourist traps and you'll have hard times if you don't want to eat seafood over there... But thanks to Yelp I found this hidden American place that make good food for cheap. I didn't even thought it was fat or especially heavy. Their "club"-style sandwiches are great, and I'm pretty the rest is too. Good job!
author: Jonathan V.

description: Wow, we stumbled across this gem when honeymooning in San Francisco recently. The breakfast burritos are incredible (and huuuge!) and they make a great latte too!  Our waitress was so lovely and friendly - would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Marie S.

description: Delicious food that is "huge" in portion. Amazing friendly service, and very welcoming. Prices are cheap for a large portion and great taste. Very clean and comfortable ambience. This is officially my favorite breakfast/brunch heaven.
author: Hamad A.

description: Excellent!!!!!  Staff is wonderful!!!   Probably the best classic breakfast ever!!!  Everything was hot, fresh and fantastic.
author: Lakeisha G.

description: We have eaten here every day we have been in San Francisco. Everything on the menu is delicious! A great outside dining experience. Fabulous staff, they all are very attentive and personable.
author: JJ G.

description: Nice cozy brekky place.  Great service with a smile!  Flavors are on point - eggs were stellar.
author: Robert S.

description: We were staying at the Marriott next door and and stumbled onto this diner for breakfast.  We had previously eaten at Mamas and Hollywood Cafe earlier in the week.  This place was great!  Favorite breakfast this week!  We had French toast, blueberry pancakes, burrito and omelet. Awesome find!!!!! Great food and service!
author: Christy F.

description:
I love that they're open early when all the other shops around fishermans is closed AND they recruit patrons outside their restaurant to come inside and eat breakfast with them. That's what won my heart over as I stood outside looking at their menu :) 

I was honestly only looking for a place to sit and stay inside because it was so darn cold in SF while I was waiting for my friends to finish swimming sharkfest. I ended up getting the chai tea latte and it was actually better than starbucks! The only thing is that I wish the cup was bigger because the price was a bit on the higher end for that size. But my waiters were pleasant and very friendly. They didnt even kick me out after I finished up my chai tea and started journaling. :)
author: Jeena L.

description:
Maybe it was because we had an awesome breakfast at a place 5 minute walk away the day before, but Joanie's breakfast was a big let down.

Joanie's staff was friendly, and service was fast. But the food was below average - Belgian waffle were GREAT, but countered by a spartan bowl of oatmeal with minimal fixin's, and what looked like a slice of Kraft cheese melted on my omelette. Joanie, I am disappoint.

And the coffee... the couple from the Kansas next to us liked the colored water, but I want a cup of bold, rich, flavorful coffee with my breakfast. This was not it. Not even close.

And the price? Just a tad higher than the other place (see my other review). Sorry Joanie, you won't get my business again.
author: Stephen P.

description: Good fresh food cooked how we all like it! Friendly staff -- I'd come again. PS, instead of showing Wild Kingdom on the tv behind the counter, play 50s music or loop re-runs of Happy Days. It would up the ambiance!
author: Christi Z.

description:
Good basic diner food. Great menu bc lotsa options. 

Tho good for adults, great for kids too (wasn't too crowded at peak lunch time) bc always a steady stream of patrons rather than 1 big rush. Plus you can sit outdoors (great with our stroller.)

Great & accommodating service.
author: EK K.

description:
What a find !  

We were looking for breakfast houses to go to during Fleet Week / Columbus Day weekend.  Found this and were we happy !  The food is plentiful and delicious.  The wait staff attentive and cheerful.  The owner / chef came out to ensure we were happy and even stayed to chat a while with us.

It was a wonderful start to our day.
author: Betty S.

description: Good breakfast grub.  Food cost is reasonable and the service was fast.  This is a great option if the Hollywood Cafe or Buena Vista are full.
author: Mark E.

description:
I love it here... good breakfasts, very good coffee and excellent service.

Even if you are semi-regular, they will remember your name.
author: Wendy M.

description: This was a great recommendation from the hotel concierge. Seating was not an issue, the service was fast and friendly and the food was excellent.
author: Anne W.

description: Don't let the name fool you.  This isn't a tourist place.  This is a great, neighborhood diner focused on diner foods with huge portions!   Near many of the hotels in the "Pier 39" area, worth the short walk.  The staff were extremely friendly and the food was very good.  The breakfast was large enough we weren't hungry until dinner that evening.
author: James M.

description: Family of 4, one in a wheelchair.  Very hospitable.  Servers friendly and quick.  Breakfast meal was just right.  Well prepared with generous portions with everything ordered.  Coffee was good.  Couldn't find Joanie, Staff apologized.
author: Gary W.

description: Food is amazing! Had breakfast here and you can not go wrong. Held us over until dinner but funny thing is we didn't feel grossly full just ate good food that was able to keep us full! Definitely recommend!
author: Marie S.

description: This place definitely seems like a place for the tourists. Despite the friendly service, doesn't seem like this place gets a lot of regulars. Coffee flows here every 5 minutes with the friendly smile and the check on how the food is. The menu looks like the traditional breakfast, with a couple of seafood regional touches such as the Pacifica Scramble, with shrimp. The food is pretty good, the only real downer were the hash browns, a little thin and over-fried, but I gotta stay away from carbs anyway, so they did me a favor.
author: Steve R.

description: Really good breakfast and very fast service! The owner is very nice and very helpful, and everyone is nice. The owner even came out and moved an umbrella to give us some shade. It was a great place and great atmosphere!
author: Brandon J.

description: I haven't been to SF since my teens but it was nice to know I can have a great breakfast in the morning at this establishment.  I had the crab benedict and my son had the corn beef hash and eggs.  The service was friendly and efficient.  The portions were generous!!  Finally the food was delicious.  I can't say more except come hungry.  The staff make sure your visit is satisfactory!!
author: Anthony R.

description: If you're a true foodie this place is NOT for you. We came looking for a good breakfast and decided to give this place a try even though it was in Fisherman's Wharf. Sizes we're huge but quality is poor and there is way better breakfast places a mile closer the city. The crab meat tasted canned and the crappy coffee was $3! Take the walk and try something like Mamas in Little Italy!
author: Lauren E.

description: I was slightly skeptical, when the host was half-yelling, half-corralling us into this restaurant as we crossed the street .  We both wanted a quick breakfast meal, and this place did not disappoint.  We were seated quickly, and served an AMAZING cup of coffee, with quick and frequent refills.  I wasn't expecting such wonderful coffee for a breakfast place..
author: Carina T.

description: A hidden gem - we're local and have been coming in for years. Not much to look at from the outside, but the breakfast food is consistently good and the staff is friendly and helpful. The corned beef hash and breakfast burrito are perennial favorites, and the fruit plate is great too.
author: Ryan D.

description: I had the Corned Beef and Hash Eggs Benedict...  OMG AMAZING!!! They were sooooo good! This is a side walk cafe that is easy to walk by but make no mistake they are great for a tastes bite!!!! Service was swift and the staff was kind!!!
author: Michael W.

description:
After an unpleasant breakfast experience at IHOP, we were happy to discover this diner right behind our hotel.

The diner had a nostalgic feel to it, but since the weather was so beautiful, we opted to sit outside. The menu had lots of breakfast items to choose from and prices were reasonable. Service was pleasant and we received our food promptly. 

We were so happy to have found a great breakfast spot that we returned the next morning for another round of great food. If I'm ever in San Fran again, I will keep this place in mind.
author: Dorotka K.

description: Great breakfast spot, very hospitable and the food is great. Portions were good sized and the price is comparable to the rest of this area.
author: Lee H.

description:
The best place you can go to for an omelet, burger, etc. I've been there numerous times and every time I go there it feels like home. 

The people there are awesome especially one ninja named DUHRELLL. 

But seriously, if you're visiting San Francisco, go pay them a visit. And if you live in/near San Francisco, you should be sitting in there right now reading this review.
author: Denny N.

description: We came here with friends on a lazy Sunday afternoon. They were just closing up but when they saw us hovering around the entrance they practically rolled out the red carpet! We felt so welcome and the pictures of the food looked awesome so we decided to try it. It was a beautiful day and they had put away the table and chairs out front, but they set them back up for us so we could sit outside and enjoy the weather. I had the Corned beef hash Benedict. It was fantastic! Joanie herself served us and she was so sweet and attentive. Everyone's orders came out looking just like the photos! It was pretty amazing. It was all hot and fresh and delicious. I can't wait to go back again!
author: Dawn B.

description: Went here after too much fun on a Friday night! (Not an easy morning to say the least...) It was right by our hotel, so we thought we'd give it a shot. YUMMY! I tried the chocolate Belgian waffle, yes I went for it, and man was it G-O-O-D! The service was fast & the servers were super friendly! Thank you for helping us hungover girls out! HAH! Will we back..YES!
author: Karen F.

description: This place had friendly staff.  It seems to be a little family place.  It was packed the entire time we were there.  My husband had a Spanish omelette and enjoyed it.  I had eggs Benedict and thought it was decent... Not wonderful and not bad.  My English muffins were a little tough to cut through, but the meal tasted fine. My potatoes seemed salty but I don't eat a lot of salt to begin with, so it's possible it was just more my taste buds.  My husband said his potatoes were fine and didn't seem too salty.  They kept our coffee and water full and even offered my husband the staff's flavored creamer when he asked if they had any.  It was a good place to decompress and grab a quick meal after traveling all day.
author: B D.

description: Amazing breakfast. I had Belgian Waffles with fruit and my partner had eggs with country style potatoes. Everything was really good and the price was reasonable. I would go here again :)
author: Tommy H.

description:
Excellent! 
Great food, very reasonable prices. Fun family run atmosphere great value
author: Jonathan P.

description: I work for the courtyard Marriot only a block away and we always recommend our guests here. The staff is wonderful and they are very hospitable even for young people. I call for my good ahead of time and they even call me by my name. It's rather nice. The food it self is a mean American breakfast with all the deliciousness included. It's about the same price you would pay anywhere else for a breakfast yet you get so much more
author: Christopher M.

description: Awesome. We stumbled upon this place in search of a great breakfast.  It was the best decision we could've made. The food is so well prepared and fresh, and the customer service is so wonderful, that we've come back every day. We'll truly miss this place when we head back to the east coast. Must visit! Thanks.
author: Jason B.

description: Was looking for a breakfast place close to my hotel and came upon this diner.  The place looks nice and the service was good. I just wasn't a big fan of the food. It tasted "ok".  Not bad, but not great either.  They do though give big portions. I ordered the breakfast burrito (bacon).  It was large but the overall taste was bland.  The country potatoes in it left a lot to be desired.
author: Nick M.

description: The food was fine, the service was fairly quick. I got a veg breakfast burrito and the amount of avocado in it was minimal! It was more than half hash browns, with some egg, onions, peppers and aforementioned minimal avocado. However it was a good size and I was full before it was gone. It cost $10, which was ok. My companion got a sausage egg sandwich which was also $10, had two pieces of sausage and lots of egg... he seemed more impressed than me. I would go here again, just may order differently.
author: Tammy S.

description: Kept the coffee comin'...home fries were a little under seasoned and veggie scramble was also a little bland. But very nice staff and great outdoor seating. We even left our credit card there accidentally and they kept it for us overnight in the register safe and sound.
author: Stacey I.

description: Hands down, the best breakfast in the area. Service was awesome. Fresh fruit along with your meal was a must.
author: James T.

description: Expensive for what it was. Tiny coffees for $3. Mediocre hashbrowns. And my English muffin came out a good 10 minutes before the meal so it was cold by the time I ate it. So not worth $40 for two ppl. My boyfriend on the other hand liked the place.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: While the Happy Days name didn't draw us to try Joanie's, we were pleasantly surprised to find a friendly, efficient staff delivering tasty food. Yes, we were the only locals enjoying breakfast, but the huevos a la Mexicana with chorizo were some of the most flavorful I have enjoyed outside of Colorado. We will be back!
author: G C.

description: This restaurant has fantastic service! I'm in town from Los Angeles and the service here makes me feel at home. The staff is warm and friendly, the food is great, and the location is convenient. I recommend you ask for Joanie. Also buy a souvenir tshirt they are fantastic :)
author: Natasha S.

description: We stayed at a local hotel and found Joanie's on Yelp!  While it's not the cheapest breakfast ($90 for five including tip), the food was worth every penny.  I had the California omelette and my son had the belgian waffle with strawberries and whipped cream.  Check out the pics I uploaded.  The breakfast burritos were a big hit especially with the salsa - very fresh.  While we didn't have any "lunch items", i did peruse the menu and if it's anything like breakfast, I think you'll be happy.  There is outdoor seating and the day we were there it was beautiful and a lot of people were sitting outside on the sidewalk.  Oh yeah, the service was excellent too.  Enjoy!
author: Gregory C.

description: A definite must eat at mom and pop restaraunt. Staff is awesome and the food is great! We will be coming back every time we are in Frisco!
author: Doug H.

description: Great place for breakfast.  Laid back with friendly service and big tasty omelets.  I stopped by the Hollywood Cafe but there was a line out the door so I walked a few blocks to this place and sat right down.  Nothing fancy but clean, homey and very satisfying.  The people couldn't have been nicer.  I would definitely go back.
author: Dave L.

description: Man i go here like once a week and i love there french toast. Prices are very reasonable and the staff is great... Best part of going there today was that I booVed the ny giants fan that was sitting there and then the whole cafe started booing hahahaahah good times lets go sf
author: Tareau B.

description: Great greasy spoon food and attentive service. If your are looking for healthy portions and delicious breakfast, the this is your place.
author: Chris A.

description: Excellent food. Excellent service! Family friendly. We will definetely come back!
author: Christina O.

description: My husband and I decided to walk here from our hotel, as we were vacationing in San Francisco. We were greeted by very friendly & cheerful waiters. We were seated right away. The food was pretty good :)
author: Jessica M.

description: Good diner, although I had doubts considering it's a block from the water in Fisherman's Wharf and directly across from the Holiday Inn. I ordered the spanish omelette and it was surprisingly delicious. Poured salsa all over it which added to its flavor. Good for large groups or families, if there's room.
author: Kevin L.

description: Great service, great food, and big portions. You definitely get your moneys worth!! You must go if you are in San Francisco.
author: Lauren G.

description: We were looking for a good breakfast joint and were VERY IMPRESSED when we visited Joanies. We are from San Diego and have many great breakfast places in SD that are hard to live up to. This place beats them all! I had pancakes and eggs. My husband had the chorizo breakfast burrito which was INCREDIBLE!!! it was perfect! Service was also amazing!
author: Britt m.

description: A straight forward breakfast, but options in every category. Seems to be family run, with emphasis on customer service.  If you headed to the Buena Vista Cafe only to find they don't open until almost brunch, just go around the corner to this little shop.  The seating is somewhat limited, and can accommodate a couple of tables of up to 8 folks, without loosing the 4 and 2 tops.  Small al fresco area outside.
author: Mark L.

description: Very good service. best over-easy eggs i've ever had, cooked to perfection. I had their french toast which melted in my mouth, super delicious. Looks like i've found my new beakfast place. Oh they also serve breakfast all day.
author: Michael C.

description: Delicious food and friendly, thoughtful service.  Decor could definitely be improved but this place gets top marks in the areas that really matter.
author: nicholas b.

description:
O WOW - what a fabby little find, off the beaten track, ok 2 blocks up from warf (so worth the effort).

Cute little cafe with little outside seating area.  GREAT FOOD, no sticker shock, and wait till u hear this:  (OMG) i had purchase wine just a few minutes previously, so i thought, i will ask - can i crack a bottle, they go well SURE (YIPPEE).  Si crack my white, i am good to go!  The chicken ceaser was YUM.  Kids had ham and grilled chesse which was gobbled up (so never happens) and the other had this HUGE club - disappeared.

Our waitress was so nice and 'real'.  I hear their breakfast is totally great, i looked at menu, i think it was 2 pages long of choices.  I would so totally reccomend this place.  

(FYI - this place, although in tourist area, locals go too, they were beside me on each side - that's also got to say something!)
author: LINDA R.

description: Great hole in the wall restaurant! Great portions and prices.  Breakfast was quick and tasty!  Staff friendly and efficient.  Enjoyed everything!
author: Eric P.

description: Great Great Great!  I think I made my point.  There were 12 in our family and they accommodated us 3 mornings in a row.  Joanie's has wonderful breakfast, fresh fruit that is sweet and is very clean.  The coffee was overflowing and the staff was very nice.  Please eat there.
author: Traci W.

description: Good service and food was pretty good.  The crab cake not good.  Biscuits and gravy good.
author: Karen P.

description: This place has the best breakfast in San Francisco! The food is fresh, good presentation. The place is clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We will definitely be coming back next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Nidia R.

description: GREAT omelletes. I had the mushroom, jack cheese, spinach one which was very filling and it came with toast and hashbrowns. WIN! We didn't have to worry about parking because we just walked over from our hotel. I imagine if you bring a car, it could be a pain to find parking.
author: Rachel P.

description: Best breakfast I had on my whole visit to San Francisco! Quaint little place with both indoor and outdoor seating. Large menu selection. Had the Belgium waffle with fresh fruit. It was absolutely delish! Tender crisp waffle topped with sweet fresh strawberries & blueberries. Syrup was served warm in a cute little mini-pitcher. Service was great! The two waiters were very nice and checked back with us often to refill coffee and ask if we wanted anything else.  Even my 20 month old nephew loved the oatmeal with raisins there! Wish we had found this place earlier!
author: Jodi L.

description:
Neat little place around the corner from the Holiday Inn. We sat on the sidewalk and really enjoyed ourselves. Great service with really nice staff. Our food was very good and reasonably priced. I really liked the coffee, too which is a big plus for me.

Only small thing was that they forgot somehting on my wife's meal, but quickly fixed it and very apologetic.

I recommend for sure.
author: Chris C.

description: Happy days indeed. I feel likeI'm sitting at a café in Paris by the bay. Delicious! best in the wharf
author: eric s.

description: So far my SF fav because they actually have fountain coke. Yum.Thought this place looked a little shady from the outside (but those can be the best!) but the menu looked good and the tiny restaurant was packed for breakfast so we figured...why not? And it did not disappoint. I got eggs and French toast. Hubs got some meat/egg scrabbled concoction and both were good! San Frans can do breakfast!!
author: Mindy R.

description: Yelpers of the world. Thank you. This place is great. Coffee excellent. Scrambled eggs excellent. Sour dough toast excellent. Bacon...outstanding!!!
author: Michael C.

description: Food was good and def quantity was huge! The workers were great! And I did not see or hear anyone harassing people passing by. He was very courteous, and just did his job which was try and sell, but not at all pushy or persistent by any means! I will def eat there again if I ever go back to San Francisco!
author: Marisol F.

description: Good stuff to get your day started. Here on vacation? Start here to get away from all the tourist spots and start you way into the city for the day.
author: Tim C.

description: What a great find. Temporarily living down at the Waterfront for the past 2 months. Easy to walk to... Great quick And friendly service but the best part was the food!  Delicious!  My boyfriend had the Sausage Breakfast Burrito and the sausage was amazing. I had the scramble with spinach & ham! Yum. I asked for my sourdough toast well toasted and it was!  Servers kept our coffee hot & fresh through our whole meal!  Can't wait to go back and try the Pancakes.
author: Steffie G.

description: This is a VERY good breakfast place.  All dishes are served picture perfect, and the service is excellent.  The staff is so courteous, it takes me by surprise.  All their ingredients seem fresh.  I ordered a side order of fruit today, and it was enormous, and had everything I like: strawberries, cantaloupe, bananas, watermelon and kiwi.  I can never go wrong when eating here.
author: Amber M.

description:
We ate there 3 days in a row!  Joanies Diner was that good.  It opens at 6:30 so was great for getting an early start on the day.  It is a small place, about a dozen tables, with some outside seating.  It is across from a pretty little park and the location is convenient,  just up the street from Hyde wharf and near the cable car line.

A friendly waiter waved us on in, and later shook our hands and thanked us for coming.  Found out it was the owner!  

Our spinach mushroom cheese omelet was very tasty, and served with delicious real homemade fried potatoes and green onions.  Good coffee too which isn't easy to find everywhere.  Generous fruit plate.

Great service by the young waiters who checked in with us often. Usually every table was filled before we left which shows how good it was.

We were fortunate to have been recommended to this very welcoming and quality minded restaurant.
author: Janed B.

description: We typically come here every time we are in San Francisco. Small place, great food. I highly recommend the smoked salmon eggs Benedict. Delish!
author: Mindy M.

description: They forgot my yogurt! Other than that, the service was great and the staff was friendly. We just went in for a light meal and it came out quickly, which is all you can ask for.
author: Kyle H.

description: This is one of the best breakfasts i have had in the past two weeks.  My omelette was excellent, and the rest of my family's meals were also delicious.  The wait staff was also very kind and quick with the food.  The coffee was also delicious.  Went in hungry, came out happy.
author: Big J.

description: I love breakfast so I consider my standards to be pretty high when it comes to THE MOST important meal of the day.  The place can get a little tight when it's packed, but that should be a good sign, right? Good food = packed placed...period!  The mister and I were sold on the picture of their crab benedict.  It looked so good we decided not to share and each got our own (we usually get 2 different items when we eat out so that we can try different plates).  Then out comes this deliciously generous plate that filled my belly to it's warm content.  *smiley face* I wish I was able to snap a picture to post, but I just couldn't wait to dive right in when it came out.  You'll have to take my word for it and try this place out yourself.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Linda K.

description: This place has great food, excellent presentation, and fantastic service. You will love it. They pride themselves on their style. It's refreshing to get this type of service from restaurants on North Beach. At the table of 9 everyone had a little of everything: omellettes, pancakes, breakfast burritos, porridge, home style potatoes, hashbrowns and not one complaint in the bunch.
author: Bibi C.

description: Great breakfast place near the Wharf. Decor isn't much but the food makes up for it. Omelets and coffee were delicious. Workers were super friendly and always kept my coffee cup full. I didn't have to ever ask for anything.
author: Murray K.

description: Good food, polite waiters, competitive prices
author: Gary A.

description: Love this place. Service is fast and food is always on point. The waffles are cooked to perfection.
author: Tori T.

description: Nice little diner just off the noisy main streets. Wonderful omelettes, good coffee, friendly staff.  One staffer  chased us down for a block after my husband forgot his cell phone. Can't beat it anywhere!
author: Jane W.

description:
Food - not bad. Good portion. Pancake was little chewy. They use processed american cheese on omelette. Bacon was overdone.

Service - excellent. Very friendly and prompt.
author: Robin H.

description:
This place is close to my work, so I've had the misfortune of making the same mistake twice by going here.  I came here the first time with a co-worker for brunch, and we were the only customers at the diner.  I ordered a waffle and remember waiting in anticipation for my $8.00 waffle thinking that for that price they must make it right there in their kitchen. HA!  It took 20 minutes to get served, and they didn't bring out any syrup so I had to especially ask for it, which took another 5 minutes.  Most dissapointing was that the waffle wasn't homemade but a frozen batch reheated... barely, as it was below room temperature when I bit into.

Well, everyone has bad days, so I went there again today with a different coworker for lunch.  Not being entirely hungry, I just got a vanilla milkshake with no whip cream (please) and a side order while my coworker ordered an avacado burger.  The service was fast -- though why does it take longer to make a milkshake than a burger? -- however, the avocado burger came with no avocados. Huh?  And since they were out of vanilla ice cream I had to chang my order to a chocolate milkshake.  I received it a minute later with whip cream on top. Doh!  I must say though, the milkshake was very yummy.

Overall, too pricey for entirely average food and sub par service and atmosphere. Go elsewhere.
author: Vicky B.

description: Boo yeah! Very good food! Sadly we missed this place even though it was right across the street from our hotel. If you are staying at Fisherman's Wharf, want to eat good food for lass that a corporate restaurant, go here! You cannot go wrong!
author: Derrick S.

description: Fantastic breakfast with wonderful service.  Portions are quite large, so perhaps think twice about allowing your 11 year old daughter to order a full stack of pancakes.  Highly recommended.
author: Mike D.

description: Great service but kind of pricy.  My family had pancakes, toast, eggs, etc.  Nothing extraordinary.
author: J C.

description: We were vacationing in San Francisco and were staying at a motel that had a less than desired "continental breakfast"... we planned on eating breakfast at a restaurant we had reccommended to us, but as it turned out they weren't open yet. So... we were walking along trying to find another place to go and saw this little hole-in-the-wall place. It was great! We were seated right away, the waiters and waitresses were constantly busy and on top of every table. Our waitress never let our coffee cups go empty. And the food was great! I got a waffle and fruit and my friend got the waffle breakfast with sausage and eggs. The presentation of the food was even more than I expected, and it was just plain yummy. =) It was a very pleasant surprise, and start to our day! =)
author: Jennifer M.

description:
The staff over at Joanie's embodies incompetence.

I'm a vegetarian and, needless to say to everyone but the staff over at Joanie's, I get upset when I'm fed meat.

Each time I order I'm very specific: "veggie-burger", "no bacon", etc.

Yet they have managed to screw up so many times now so I lost count.

When I took a bite off my supposedly vegetarian burger today and realized it was in fact a very meaty burger I just felt "FUCK! Again?".

You figured that maybe the staff would offer their sincere apologies and perhaps a refund when screwing up in such major way for not the first time, but no. Just a small nod and "we'll make you a new one". Sure, never mind that I feel disgusted and that my lunch with my co-workers is ruined as I have to wait another 15 minutes and eat by myself.

No, this was it. Never again.
author: Pastor Z.

description:
Mediocre 
Guy stands outside harassing passerbys to eat and was distracting and annoying
Coffee had no flavor
French toast adequate
author: Jeffrey F.

description: Great breakfast, very friendly staff. We got here early, 7:30... No wait. The breakfast taco was awesome, fresh blueberry pancakes, just a real nice, not too expensive place! Go here!!
author: Tom G.

description: Glad we found this place. There's not a lot open this early, but we found this place when going next door to rent bikes. We had breakfast burritos and they were large and fantastic! The menu was also great with lots of breakfast options and prices were reasonable.
author: Lisa D.

description: While staying in a nearby hotel, I asked the staff for a "locals place" for breakfast. He pointed me to Joanie's. Excellent service (very attentive) and food (I had short stack blueberry pancakes and fruit). Great find!
author: Scott C.

description: Everything was great!  I ordered spinach omellette and loved it.  They used fresh materials to cook, not frozen fruits or vegetables.  Service was super!  They had no problem accommodating my special diet.  Will definitely come again!!!
author: Ili H.

description: Joanie is great! The food is standard diner food done well, but cheap and with a smile. Locals get 20% off too!!
author: Peter W.

description: My wife and I had such a great breakfast on Friday that we went back on Saturday.  I had the corned beef eggs benedict with hash browns both days.  Absolutely delicious.  My wife had pancakes and then the waffles with bananas and enjoyed  them both.  I was surprised that they served mimosas but they were a great way to start the weekend.  The prices were reasonable and the staff was very friendly.  A great place for breakfast.
author: Charlie S.

description:
I am giving Joanie's two stars for two reasons:

1. Their servers: the girls are very upbeat and very very nice.  
2.  Their breakfast burritos ROCK!

So ... the rest... The owner/manager: She tries to be very friendly and talkative and I guess if you need someone trying to talk to you while you eat, thats fine.  I work nearby and only have a half an hour to eat.  I bring my paper or book with me *hint: dont bother me*.  I hear her talking to other customers/friends and some of the convos are VERY unprofessional and your other customers don't need to hear you talk smack about who you don't like.

Also, I now get sandwiches, soup, and bagels from Coffee Adventures, right next door.  And once you have had FRESH, good sandwiches you just cant go back to Joanie's.  Thier food/drinks are not made fresh and you can taste the difference.  No fresh lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, or bread.  

But ... as I said ... their breakfast burritos rock!
author: Sofia G.

description: Ewwww.  My husband's bagel breakfast sandwich was dripping...undercooked egg?  Grease?  Not sure, but the taste wasn't so good anyhow.  My eggs florentine had frozen spinach and one egg was over-poached.  Our daughter liked her sandwich.  Coffee was average.  Hollywood cafe is just around the corner on North Point.  Waaayyyy better!!!  We were in from the Midwest visiting.   Breakfast should be easy to fix, relative to other meals.  This place just wasn't up to snuff for a foodie city like SF.
author: Nancy F.

description:
I have never been a breakfast fan, for as long as i have lived,  i never cared for american breakfast..coz i don't eat meat..nd im not a big starch fan..until i found this place recently. it was so good! i had the vegetarian scramble w/ hashbrown nd wheat bread w/ jam. I needa go back nd get the homestyle potatoes. my sister gots the vegetarian omelet w/ the homestyle poatoes..i tried nd damn it was better than the hashbrown. and i never like homestyle potatoes ever, ive been to so many breakfast places to see variety nd recipe/taste..i like jpanie's happy days. it made me very happy.  the price is good too, my dish was less than 10 i believe.
they do close early tho. hence their website sayin they close at 4. they really close at 2, depending on business, u know how that works.
author: Janet W.

description: So good, we ate breakfast there twice on a four day trip! The corned beef hash and eggs and the corned beef hash eggs benedict were awesome! Will definitely go back on our next trip to SF.
author: Heywood J.

description: waved in from the street,, how cute !  crowded place,  "it must be good",,, food as great , i had pacifica omelet.... yummy !  a bit crowded but that the SF way
author: Nicole B.

description: We tried several breakfast places while on our San Francisco trip, but this has been our favorite. The food is great and reasonably priced for the area. My wife and I can not say enough about the staff, they have all been wonderful. Even when they've been busy the servers have been on top of your every need. We definitely recommend Joanie's!!
author: Alan W.

description: Excellent breakfast. Great service. Put this on your list.
author: Chris S.

description: This diner was right across the street from our hotel, Holiday Inn. The service was excellent! The servers were friendly and attentive. Our meals arrived at our table shortly after we placed our order. My husband and I enjoyed scrumptious omelettes while our two children devoured chocolate Belgian waffles. Glancing around the restaurant, I wished I had ordered a menu item featuring their fresh fruit. The banana Belgian waffles and fruit bowls looked amazing! I will definitely dine here again!
author: Ryan S.

description: This place has an awesome atmosphere. The people are very friendly and the pancakes were decently big. The food was very good. the wait was a bit long, but was worth it over all. Cleanliness could have been a bit better, but wasn't to bad. I would go back next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Rachel L.

description: Didn't like the food = hash browns, eggs, bacon, English muffin.  Floor was dirty and some food flies.  Close to wharf and Ghiardellis.  Waiters were awesome.  Very fast and upbeat.  Waffles and pancakes were good.  OJ was ok.
author: Bob W.

description: i love the staff here. really friendly, family style. i had only one meal and it surely was nothing to write home about, but the atmosphere made up for it. a good all around diner to go and fill ur gut.
author: S. G.

description: I have been to a ton of Yuppie Marina Breakfast places for Mediocre Omlettes just to look at fit birds but if you just want a great Breakfast this is the place.  The Western Omlette with Ground Chuck Beef is Delicous.  The owner is such a nice lady as well as the entire staff.  The firts time I went in with bui\ddies she brought us a plate of Fruit on the house.  It is great service and great food.  As much as I love Mamas for Breakfast I will not deal with waiting an hour plus in line on a weekend.  Joanies is great and a must to try out.
author: Harry E.

description: This place has tasty breakfast items and huge portions.  Their servers are really nice and keep the coffee refills comin'.  It gets pretty busy on the weekend so be ready to wait for a table.  They also have outdoor seating for sunny SF days.  They also have cute t-shirts if you're looking for a unique souvenir.
author: Nina L.

description: Great food. Pancakes are excellent. Good service.
author: J L.

description: Fast service, food resonably priced. Went here for bkfast. Come early to avoid wait. Food more like $ than $$ per entre.
author: Jason H.

description: The help was friendly, but that was about all that I have to say that is good abotut his place. I asked how big the salad was, and was assured that it was "really big." it came out in a normal bowl, and they "don't carry" bread or crackers to eat with salads. My wife got a breakfast burrito that had ham, eggs, and a slice of american cheese. I should have gotten pancakes. we each got water, and our bill came to $20. Rip off.
author: Josh R.

description: Breakfast is great and the food is so good huge portion best of all coffee cup never empty.
author: Yuuhi S.

description: As soon as I walked in to Joanies me and my friend were seated immediatly by this cute asain girl.  I had the grilled cheese sandwich and my friend had the omelet with hashbrown and toast. The service at joanies was excellent, our drinks were constantly filled and the waitress was very attentive to all our needs at all time.  My overall experience at joanies was mmmm FIRST-CLASS and on top of that, the waitres was HOT, and left me hanging with a crush.
author: Kevin I.

description: The people that work there are so nice. They are just so welcoming. They have delicious food. I love that they have outdoor seating and the shirts they sell there are pretty cute for souvenirs.
author: Lily M.

description: Great place for breakfast! Much better than breakfast places nearby. Hobo Plate Scrambled was simply yummy. Denver Omlette was big enough to share. Chunky breakfast potatoes are seasoned nicely and flavored with onions. Very friendly service. Priced similarly to other places. Very busy on a Friday morning. Cramped seating, but definitely worth a visit. Yummy.
author: kurt m.

description: I picked up my sister in law & niece from the nearby Holiday Inn to take them to the airport for their flight home and we decided to first have breakfast here at Joanie's. The 'host' at the door offered the three of us a tiny table out on the sidewalk as our only option. The manager (owner?) then stepped in and said an indoor table would be available in a couple minutes. Once seated inside, our order was quickly taken by the friendly waitress. Then, we waited & waited & waited. I went to put more quarters in the parking meter & then waited some more. Finally, asked the manager about our order & it came a little while later. My niece liked her French toast & my sister in law liked her omelette. So, got to give them credit for that. My pancakes were bland and the syrup tasted watery. To give them credit, the prices for the breakfast plates are reasonable. On the other hand, they stick it to you with the price of juice & coffee. A glass of OJ was $2.99. The menu advertises it as "fresh squeezed" but it was from concentrate. On the way out, my sister in law commented on the long wait for the food and the host was like "meh." I would try some of the other nearby places for breakfast before returning here.
author: Dan U.
